programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Amy faces a fresh challenge when a fat cat, Chubbs, needs immediate facial surgery. Later, the team treats a Labradors with a backside peppered by buckshot

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia and the twins spring into action when a dog is abandoned in the swamps. Plus, a parolee struggles to deal with the pressures of work and parenthood

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia and her crew head out on one of their most dangerous rescues yet, with the lives of a mother dog and her puppies at stake. Plus, a loyal parolee reaches a crossroads

programme.title: My Cat from Hell

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy travels to Portland to help Lee and Teresa, who called 911 when their cat Lux clawed their son Jesse, after he pulled on the felines tail

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson builds an outside-in treehouse in Alaska, heating things up by installing a sauna in the trees

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: As spring arrives in Michigan, the Barn Sanctuary prepares to open for all animals. Dan and Kelly come to the rescue of a lamb in desperate need of medical care

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: New science and demonstrations reveal how cats can detect an earthquake seconds before it happens. Plus, how sea otters manage to keep warm in icy waters

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: More fun facts about the animal kingdom, including why some creatures live so long, the reason that cats purr and why elephants have trunks

programme.title: Extinct or Alive

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: The students are halfway through their spring term rotations. Lindsay has a hectic week treating a mare and foal for pneumonia

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Fourth-year student Clint assists in an emergency caesarean on a cocker spaniel, only to discover the newborn puppy may not make it

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 2 October 1998 and featuring Steps, The Beautiful South, Fastball, Republica, Sarah McLachlan, Ash, Savage Garden and B*Witched

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 9 October 1998. Featuring Ace of Base, Billie Piper, Bryan Adams, Brandy feat Ma$e, The Cause, UB40 and B*Witched.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds presents a vintage edition of the pop show from November 10, 1977. Featuring music by the Tom Robinson Band, Tina Charles, Darts, Kenny Everett and Mike Vickers, Roxy Music, Boney M, Elvis Costello, Ruby Winters, Santana and Abba, plus a dance routine by Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell hosts the edition first shown on November 9, featuring performances by Janet Jackson, Electribe 101, Lisa Stansfield, Aaron Neville and Linda Ronstadt, and the Wonder Stuff

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the first years of Top of the Pops, featuring the Rolling Stones, Peter Sarstedt, Tom Jones, Stevie Wonder, Julie Driscoll, Queen, the Kinks, Procol Harum, Stealers Wheel, the Seekers and Status Quo

programme.title: Jeff Buckley Live in Chicago
programme.desc: Jeff Buckley in a 1995 concert, performing a selection of songs from Grace, the only album of his music released in his lifetime, at the Metro, Chicago. He also performs his own take on songs by MC5, James H Shelton, Big Star and Leonard Cohen. First broadcast 3 June 2002

programme.title: 40 Originals at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of 40 big hits by the artists that originally performed them, such as John Fogertys Rockin All Over the World - which became synonymous with 1970s rockers Status Quo - and Lori Liebermans Killing Me Softly with His Song - covered by many artists, including Roberta Flack. Others featured include Gladys Knight, Neil Diamond, Nine Inch Nails, Dolly Parton and the Zutons, whose song Valerie became a massive hit for Amy Whitehouse

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James and Siegfried face a dilemma when an old acquaintance appears to be stealing from them - and to make matters worse, their friends dog is accused of killing sheep. Guest starring James Ellis (Z Cars), with Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried is pleased with his new time-management system - until he misplaces his diary and has an unfortunate encounter with a Great Dane. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried wants to know why the usually kind Mrs Clarke is snubbing her new Italian neighbour, while James gives Tricky Woo female hormones. Thora Hird guest stars, with Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Craven and Jedburgh follow in Emmas fateful footsteps and enter the nuclear facility of Northmoor, unaware the plants security staff know theyre on the way. Penultimate part of the award-winning thriller, starring Bob Peck

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Jedburgh obtains the plutonium which proves Northmoor has been running an illegal weapons plant, but he and Craven are exposed to deadly radiation. While waiting to die, they head for an international atomic energy conference for a final confrontation with Grogan. Troy Kennedy Martins political thriller, starring Bob Peck, Joe Don Baker and Joanne Whalley

programme.title: Wogan
programme.sub-title: June Whitfield, Marvin Mitchelson and Anthony Burgess
programme.desc: Terry Wogan is joined by actress June Whitfield, celebrity lawyer Marvin Mitchelson and author Anthony Burgess. First broadcast in 1985

programme.title: The Many Faces of June Whitfield
programme.desc: The comedy actress tells the story of her career, focusing on her early days in the West End working with Noel Coward, her ill-fated Broadway debut and, with the help of rarely seen archive footage, her years of TV and radio performances. She also offers an insight into her on-screen relationship with Terry Scott and the secret behind her continuing success. With contributions by Sylvia Syms, Nicholas Parsons and Junes daughter Suzy Aitchison

programme.title: Happy Ever After
programme.desc: A couple attempt to adjust to life alone after their children have flown the nest. Pilot episode of the sitcom first broadcast in 1974 as part of Comedy Playhouse, starring Terry Scott and June Whitfield

programme.title: Beggar My Neighbour
programme.desc: Two sisters and their husbands live as neighbours in north London and while one couple struggles financially but maintains appearances, the others prosperity leads to social pretensions, except for the wealthy and humble husband. Comedy, starring June Whitfield, Reg Varney, Pat Coombs and Peter Jones. First broadcast in 1967

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James and Siegfried face a dilemma when an old acquaintance appears to be stealing from them - and to make matters worse, their friends dog is accused of killing sheep. Guest starring James Ellis (Z Cars), with Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried is pleased with his new time-management system - until he misplaces his diary and has an unfortunate encounter with a Great Dane. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Ugo Monye and Kym Marsh prtesent the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: My Holiday Was Cancelled at Hotel Check-in
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford, and Louise Minchin investigate how mysterious behaviour by one failing tour operator meant that customers were left stranded abroad with nowhere to stay and without any of the protections they thought they had. Plus, more on the investigation into timeshares and their empty promises and guidance on hiring a car while abroad

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is at a mid-terrace house in Stoke-on-Trent that seems too good to be true and Jacqui Joseph is fretting over the short lease on a flat in south-east London. A terraced house in Staffordshire needs a lot more attention than originally thought

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents as two teams of comedians don the red and blue jackets to hunt for treasures and raise money for a good cause in Sussex. The red team features Russell Kane and Ignacio Lopez alongside expert Danny Sebastian while Jo Caulfield and Stephen K Amos fly the flag for the blue team with the assistance of Kate Bliss. Their challenge is to find the best bargains and raise the most money at auction - all in the name of Pudsey and Children in Need

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: The community is shaken when one of their own is shot. Marlene heads up the investigation but when Chloes boyfriend Shane confesses, some of his story doesnt make sense. Eve is furious to find out all about Chloes secret relationship, Clint continues to give Brandi a hard time and Marlene discovers that Donal is falling for Sasha

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A retired army couple looking to escape busy Bedfordshire enlist Margherita Taylor to help them spend their house-hunting budget of £680,000 in the rural wilds of Norfolk. On their wish list are three bedrooms, some land, a potential income and seclusion. Taking a break from the properties, Margherita learns about the worlds most expensive spice - saffron

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull are in Tamworth, Staffordshire, to transform mum Jade and daughter Charlies tiny unloved plot into a garden inspired by all different shades of their favourite colour, pink, with a budget of £4,500

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: In west Wales, David Harper buys a collection of tourist trinkets and Roo Irvine finds some refined silver spoons to sell at auction. The pair also have a close encounter with some of the insect worlds most flamboyant characters and a few unsung invertebrate heroes

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Mel Giedroyc on the quiz, with contestants looking for obscure answers to questions on topics including Bluey and Victorian literature

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Children in Need
programme.desc: Ade Adepitan, Mel Giedroyc, Rochelle Humes, Vernon Kay, Paddy McGuinness, Big Zuu and Lenny Rush present a jam-packed evening of sketches and performances featuring well-known faces helping raise life-changing funds for young people across the UK. Highlights include specials for The Apprentice, Strictly Come Dancing and Gladiators, challenges and appeal films featuring the children and young people that the charity support and music from Lewis Capaldi. The BBC Children in Need Choir also returns, featuring 16 children from across the 15 BBC nations and regions, who have been supported by Children in Need-funded projects, performing a special arrangement of Coldplays Yellow - Pudseys favourite colour. There will also be an appearance from the cast of Andrew Lloyd Webbers Starlight Express, featuring 17-year-old Eloise, a member of the One Show Challenge Squad. Plus, reports of activities from around the area between 7.00 and 8.00

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Children in Need
programme.desc: Pudsey joins Holly Hamilton and Connor Phillips as they meet some of the organisations and young people that benefit from BBC Children in Need. Pudsey travels to Omagh for the Children in Need choir, and Cate Conway joins Connor for a three-legged walk from Portadown to Newry

programme.title: Bridget Joness Diary
programme.desc: A single woman begins a new year with resolutions to find love, quit her bad habits and take a step up the career ladder. Her plans crumble as she tries to deal with her mothers infidelity, get over a passionate fling with her boss and come to terms with her feelings for an uptight lawyer. Romantic comedy based on Helen Fieldings novel, starring Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The remaining queens give drag makeovers to celebrity guests Charlotte Church, Michelle McManus, Dani Harmer, Shobna Gulati, Diane Parish and David Potts. Sugababe Mutya Buena joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Graham Norton on the judging panel

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Jolene Yu, Xiengni Zhou, Vivek Singh, Jess Shadbolt and Olly Murs. Olly Smith picks the drinks to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Mary Berry and kindred spirit Jamie Oliver cook up delicious family favourites, share memories watching old footage of Mary, and have a very competitive football match. The pair also cook a mushroom-stuffed watercroft chicken, an updated way to make lamb with a rich spiced tagine, a prawn curry, and a lemon drizzle cake

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the contest from Shrewsbury in Shropshire. Experts Thomas Forrester and Mark Stacey guide the red and blue teams as they search for the best items and sell at auction in Lichfield, Staffordshire. Caroline also brings along an unusual-looking antique and asks the fairgoers what they think it is

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 1.30pm). All the action from the derby at Etihad Stadium. These teams finished fourth and third respectively in the league last term, and they have both made strong starts to the current campaign as they look to challenge champions Chelsea for the title

programme.title: Nativity!
programme.desc: A primary school teacher is given the job of directing a nativity play and is determined to outdo a rival from a nearby private school. When he dishonestly claims his ex-girlfriend is a Hollywood producer and is coming to see the show with an eye on making a film, he finds himself becoming a local celebrity. Comedy, starring Martin Freeman and Ashley Jensen

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the game show, which sees a mother and daughter from Liverpool, two friends from Whitstable and a couple from Llanelli trying to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: The couples show off another routine in a bid to impress judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke, as well as the viewers, in the hope of making it through to next weeks Blackpool show. Theyll be working hard to stay as far away from the bottom of the leaderboard as possible - but as the series has proved, thats no guarantee of avoiding the dance off. Presented by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley, Maisie Adam, Oti Mabuse, Asim Chaudhry, Ricky Wilson, Omid Djalili and Joey Essex join in the fun on the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance

programme.title: Wild Cherry
programme.desc: In the town of Richford Lake, things are perfect for supermum Juliet and business mogul Lorna. But when their teenage daughters Allegra and Grace are accused by their school of filming a provocative video, this idyllic town falls to pieces. Drama, starring Eve Best and Carmen Ejogo

programme.title: Wild Cherry
programme.sub-title: Girls Are More Responsible, and She Has Her Credit Card
programme.desc: Juliets nighttime secret forces her into a dangerous lie, and Lorna confronts the past shes hiding from Grace. The girls ramp up the App with shocking results, and Iris is missing. Gigi hosts an event that takes a dark turn when the police show up

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: The disaster-prone journalist seems to have finally found the perfect boyfriend. However, when the couple start to squabble over their personal habits, she decides to decamp for a while to Thailand and write a travelogue. Unfortunately, she has reckoned without the reappearance of a duplicitous old flame - and a spell behind bars in a Thai prison. Romantic comedy sequel, with Renee Zellweger, Colin Firth, Hugh Grant, Jim Broadbent and Gemma Jones

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Rattus considers a career change, and luckily he has the whole of history to look through for ideas. Could he be an inventor like Babbage, or is the pirate life for him?

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: Slovakia v Northern Ireland (Kick-off 7.45pm). Stephen Watson presents all the action from both teams penultimate FIFA World Cup Group A qualifier, held at Košická futbalová arena. A win for the Slovakians would guarantee them a top-two finish and a place in at least the play-offs, with a contest away to group leaders Germany, who they have already defeated once to come. However, Northern Ireland will remain in contention themselves should they avoid defeat, and their remaining fixture is at home to a team they will expect to defeat in Luxembourg. The reverse fixture between these nations at Windsor Park saw Michael ONeills men claim an impressive 2-0 win thanks to a Patrik Hrošovský own goal and a strike from Trai Hume

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Former boxing star Chris Eubank and his son Chris Eubank Jr, who followed his father into the sport, are reunited after years apart to confront their fractured past. The film follows the pair as they explore their legacy, grief and the emotional cost of a life in the ring

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams must choose whether to travel through the mountainous heartland of Guatemala, explore the golden sands of southern Belize or take the path less travelled through Honduras to reach the second checkpoint of El Zonte in El Salvador

programme.title: Kensukes Kingdom
programme.desc: A boy and his dog are washed overboard from their boat, leaving them stranded on a Pacific island. The youngster finds support from a fellow castaway, who helps him to protect the fragile home he has built for himself. Animated adventure based on Michael Morpurgos novel, featuring the voices of Aaron MacGregor, Sally Hawkins, Cillian Murphy, Raffey Cassidy and Ken Watanabe

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Christopher MacArthur-Boyd hosts the fifth heat at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow, where five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house and judges Daniel Foxx, Susie McCabe and Fatiha El-Ghorri. Ayo Adenekan, Alan Jay, Kate Dolan, Calum Frost and Joe da Costa perform five minute sets in hopes of earning a place in the final at the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford

programme.title: Kirkmoore
programme.desc: Chloe, Jack and David navigate life at Kirkmoore, a residential college for disabled students. Girl-obsessed Jack is determined to get David to come on a night out but all he wants to do is knuckle down and finish his essay. Chloe has an online date. Comedy, starring Keron Day, Francesca Mills and Chris Slater

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott experiences Ko Phangans famous Full Moon Party, but beneath the cheap cocktails, music and fire shows, theres danger lurking as the medical team treat a possible drink-spiking victim. She then travels to Phuket and experiences a taste of Thailands luxury lifestyle. But she also learns how dream holidays can quickly go wrong, hearing the case of a British holiday-maker who died on the island - and whose family is still searching for answers

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Former boxing star Chris Eubank and his son Chris Eubank Jr, who followed his father into the sport, are reunited after years apart to confront their fractured past. The film follows the pair as they explore their legacy, grief and the emotional cost of a life in the ring

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of an Influencer
programme.desc: Walsalls top social media talent Manrika reveals how to be a successful and in-demand influencer, including tips on interacting with followers, promoting an aspirational lifestyle, selling healthy habits and negotiating hotel stays. Comedy, starring Manrika Khaira

programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the making of The Lodger, an episode that features a guest appearance from Gavin and Stacey star James Corden, and sees the Doctor taking to the football pitch. Karen Gillan visits the Royal Greenwich Observatory, where she meets space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock and learns about time

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord passes himself off as a human so he can investigate a series of mysterious disappearances in which people go up the stairs of a house on Aickman Street, but never come down. He shares a flat with a man living downstairs, and has a profound impact on his befuddled flatmates previously uneventful life. Guest starring James Corden and Daisy Haggard

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwens birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage

programme.title: Bridget Joness Diary
programme.desc: A single woman begins a new year with resolutions to find love, quit her bad habits and take a step up the career ladder. Her plans crumble as she tries to deal with her mothers infidelity, get over a passionate fling with her boss and come to terms with her feelings for an uptight lawyer. Romantic comedy based on Helen Fieldings novel, starring Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The remaining queens give drag makeovers to celebrity guests Charlotte Church, Michelle McManus, Dani Harmer, Shobna Gulati, Diane Parish and David Potts. Sugababe Mutya Buena joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Graham Norton on the judging panel

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The Boiler Shop arts and performance space in Newcastle is the venue for the fourth heat, which sees comics Charlie Ashton, Murph, Zoe Cousin, Caira OConnor and Shugufta Choudhry battling it out to book their place in this years grand final in Bradford. Amy Gledhill hosts the proceedings and the judges for the night are Teesside local Phil Dunning, former winner Dan Tiernan and head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Christopher MacArthur-Boyd hosts the fifth heat at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow, where five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house and judges Daniel Foxx, Susie McCabe and Fatiha El-Ghorri. Ayo Adenekan, Alan Jay, Kate Dolan, Calum Frost and Joe da Costa perform five minute sets in hopes of earning a place in the final at the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Janet starts her job managing the Archer and, in a bid to attract an older clientele, decides to give the pub a wartime theme. Donna is still intent on revenge, Jonny helps Gaz become a dad and Louise turns to prostitution. Comedy, starring Sheridan Smith and Natalie Casey

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: The gang struggles with problems as Janet tries to find a way to keep the pub open, and Louise feels unwell - though Kelly thinks she recognises the symptoms. Jonny worries he has fallen in love with Gaz and the arrival of Donnas brother causes a stir. Sheridan Smith and Kathryn Drysdale star

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Horror-themed episode of the comedy in which the gang learns the Archer is facing demolition and breaks in the night before to bid the place farewell. However, the friends soon find themselves trapped inside the sinister pub - where strange forces are intent on killing them. Ralf Little stars

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps

programme.desc: Charlotte accepts a lift to the railway station from Frasier, but his car breaks down in a desolate area and they end up spending the night in the same room as a dead body. Meanwhile, confusion arises as Niles plans Martins stag party

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink considers throwing away an old broken pot until it stirs up fond memories, including the time he was accidentally glued to a blind date and a Thanksgiving when everyone seemed to be down on their luck. American comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and John Mahoney

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. Frasiers final dinner with Charlotte is ruined by constant interruptions, Martin and Ronees wedding day is marked by a series of calamities, and Daphne goes into labour at a veterinary practice. Jason Biggs, Robbie Coltrane and Richard E Grant guest star alongside regulars Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney in the series penultimate episode

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz make waves when they hit the road in a one-of-a-kind rocket car

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: More professional chefs battle it out in the kitchen to win the £1000 prize, starting with three restaurants in and around Sheffield. Competing for the prize are a seafood restaurant, a fine-dining venue with romantic ramblings and rugby revelations on the menu, and an establishment whose staff have only been working together for four months

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The team heads to Birmingham, where Henry Cole stumbles upon a model metal tipper truck, which he is convinced will make some money

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against words and numbers. Former Olympic athlete Katharine Merry is in Dictionary Corner alongside lexicographer Susie Dent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps teachers Dominic and Helen from Leicestershire to buy a holiday home in the seaside town of Calpe on Spains Costa Blanca for them and their two children

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: In Charente, Simon and Racheal complete their first project at their ancient hamlet - with breathtaking results. Kev gives his music studio its first test run at his old quarry village. Meanwhile, after nearly four years of work, Sarah and Steves holiday accommodation at their Portuguese quinta is finally open for business

programme.title: Jasmine Harmans Renovation in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine and Jon reach the final phase of their renovation as the basement transformation nears completion. But they need to start on the kitchen if they want all the work to be done in time for their summer party. And, in an attempt to escape the dust and noise, the couple take a day trip to the local Roman baths, only to find more mud there too

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Shukesi and Nitesh are ready to make waves in their retirement with a bolthole on the Costa del Sol, known and loved for its fantastic mix of traditional Spanish life and lively resorts. Lucy Alexander shows Shukesi and Nitesh five options for their budget of £300,000

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: In Israel, a murder epidemic is devastating Arab-Israeli communities. Krishnan Guru-Murthy investigates why most of these killings go unsolved. With much focus on the conflict in Gaza and rising hostilities in the West Bank, Krishnan asks why hundreds of Arab-Israeli citizens are being murdered each year in Israel itself? Arab citizens make up one-fifth of Israels population, but nearly three-quarters of its murder victims. When Israeli-Jews are murdered around 75 percent of cases are solved, compared to around 15 percent when the victim is Arab-Israeli. Krishnan discovers Arab organised crime families tightening their grip on towns long neglected by the state. In some areas, residents say theyre living under gang rule and accuse Israels right-wing government of turning a blind eye to the killings. In the coastal town of Jisr az-Zarqa, Krishnan meets families mourning sons shot dead in the street and mothers who say the police never even came to take witness statements. He meets a former gangster who says weapons from Israels own police and army are being sold to criminals. While community figures and an opposition politician accuse the government of deliberately abandoning Arab citizens to lawlessness and fear, Israels police say its doing everything it can to stop the violence

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: Following the work of the West Midlands Police Drone Unit as they pursue suspects trying to hide up trees, discarding drugs and running away from the scene of a crime. As the team show up with a drug warrant, the suspected dealer tries to throw several wads of cash from an upstairs window - totally unaware he is being watched from above

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions of shows including Celebrity Race Across the World, Alls Fair, Squid Game: The Challenge, The 1% Club, Come Dine with Me: Teens and Police Interceptors. Plus, BBC News reports on Elon Musk and ITV and BBC News coverage of the Panorama-Donald Trump scandal

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by Richard Osman, Rosie Jones and Mike Wozniak for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag #isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Outsider

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: A group of elites gather for the first time at a remote manor house to hunt ordinary Americans for sport. However, the elites master plan is about to be derailed because one of the hunted, Crystal, knows the hunters game better than they do, and turns the tables on the killers as she makes her way toward the mysterious woman at the centre of the mystery. Director Craig Zobels horror thriller, starring Betty Gilpin, Hilary Swank and Emma Roberts

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef visits beachside restaurant Barefoot Bobs in Hull, Massachusetts, owned by husband-and-wife team Marc and Lisa. Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters arent improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before its too late

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Wizards Thatch in Alderley Edge, a village in Cheshire. Owners Ian Lambert and his partner Ali Imiolek hope to cast a spell over the competition, but their guests end up picking out problems with the continental breakfast basket

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Blackpool, where James Reay and Simon Dooley run the one-star Winterbourne Hotel and Theatre Showbar. The contestants seem to be relaxed and impressed, but a rivals feedback sends one of the hosts storming out of the room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Perfectionist Andrea Hickmott and her partner Nick Bonner-Williams welcome their guests to Northrise Lodge in Hastings, East Susses, but the rooms are criticised and deemed too clinical to relax in. Andrea also panics when she forgets to put sugar on the tables at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Stephanie and Dominic Parker (who would go on to find fame in Gogglebox) welcome the rest of the contestants to their BandB, the Salutation in Sandwich, Kent. However, an alcohol-fuelled evening of parlour games jeopardises the hosts chances to win the prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. A wedding proposal appears to be on the cards, and the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows highlighting the way working from home is changing the way many people live. Northampton newlyweds Nikki and Andy both worked from home but their cluttered terrace was close to bursting point. Meanwhile, Amber ran her own fitness classes from her home and wanted somewhere brighter and bigger for her clients. Could Kirstie persuade them to go with her redesigns or would Phil find either couple a much more suitable new place?

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Coach is given the chance to manage a Little League baseball team, but pursues the task so ruthlessly that the bar-room regulars begin to question whether they know him at all. Nicholas Colasanto stars

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: American TV host Dick Cavett persuades Sam to write his autobiography, convincing him it would be a sure-fire bestseller, and Diane reluctantly agrees to help with the manuscript. Meanwhile, an old flame of Veras is back on the scene, to Norms annoyance.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: How Do I Love Thee? Let Me Call You Back
programme.desc: Sam tells Diane he loves her, but she takes his declaration far more seriously than he intended and the pair end up taking some time off from their romance.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Dianes friend Heather flirts aggressively with Sam, making him uncomfortable - but Diane claims he is overreacting to perfectly ordinary social behaviour. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Shelley Long

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: The bar-room staff and regulars are bequeathed $100,000 by a former customer, but their new-found wealth soon causes friction. Classic comedy, starring Ted Danson and Rhea Perlman

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra clears out all the kids old baby clothes and gives them to a jumble sale, making Ray realise she is resigned to not having any more children

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of two. Flashback episode in which the Barones recall their courtship and wedding, beginning with Rays nervous marriage proposal - and subsequent uncertainty over Debras motive for accepting

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part two of two. The last-ever episode of the comedy sees Daphne give birth to a son, Martin and Ronee tie the knot and Roz surprise besotted Noel with a kiss. Faced with an empty apartment, Frasier records his final radio show before jetting off to pastures new. Anthony LaPaglia and Richard E Grant guest star

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The psychiatrist abandons his bar-propping in Boston in favour of presenting a radio show in Seattle. However, his new life is thrown into upheaval when his father moves in with him - followed by apparently psychic care assistant Daphne. First-ever episode of the comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink resents his lack of privacy now that he has to share his apartment with his father and Daphne, while Roz debates the virtues of human contact. Kelsey Grammer stars

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Im Just a Girl Who Cant Say Doh
programme.desc: Marge puts on a play written by Lisa when she gets a big job at the theatre, while Homer develops a crush on Maggies baby class supervisor

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge and Homer leave Grampa to babysit the kids, but little green army men trigger a PTSD episode, sending the family on a journey to Abes past when he was a postwar toy model

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Married couple Roy and Brian kick this competition off at the Plough Inn in Ripple in Kent. Theyre hoping their breakfast, which is somewhere between Little Chef and The Ritz, will have them onto a winner. However, their chances take an immediate dent when guests Simone and Anke find an old bathmat. Can a wet and wild afternoon of seal spotting on the River Stour help the hosts turn things around?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers head to Faringdon in Oxfordshire, where best friends Simone and Anke host the weeks second visit at The Old Crown Coaching Inn. Roy and Brian find the furnishings fit for a king, but some of the guests find the cleanliness standards to be less-than sparkling. In the afternoon, a trip up a historic tower proves a step too far for Brian. Over a well-received breakfast the next morning, two of the guests ramp up expectations for their own visit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The weeks third visit takes the BandBers to Great Bromley in Essex, where married couple Richard and Colleen host at their BandB, The Courthouse. The hosts reckon theyre onto a winner with their breakfast, but its the extra touches in the rooms that really get the BandBers singing their praises. Tensions are released during a trip to a rage room in nearby Colchester, before Richard gets teary during feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The weeks final visit is to Samsara Retreat in Kent, where Lori hosts with her friend Mike. Lori hopes to provide a relaxing, re-energising stay, and sets about giving her guests an immediate taste of what her place is all about, with a yoga, meditation and gong bath session. However, come the next morning, some of their guests arent feeling particularly rested

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers sharpen their metaphorical knives ready for Payment Day. The Plough Inn want to get to the bottom of their cleanliness comments, before Simone and Anke try to clean up Roy and Brians marks about their mattress. Richard from The Courthouse is brought to tears by some feedback, before Lori and Mike put their sleep scores under the spotlight. After some heated debate, the payments are revealed and the winners announced

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: In one of the most ambitious and eccentric builds ever, a man attempts to build a miniature canal and lock to house a narrow boat - and then turns the boat itself into something never before seen on the series. George also visits a house full of colour in London and an all-black, one-bedroom hotel housed in an old industrial crane in Denmark, while Will Hardie checks out a wooden home in a horsebox. Together, the pair put the final touch to their 18th-century-inspired cabin in the sky.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help Priti and Shakti find their first family home while staying close to the buzz of London. Cheesemonger Julia is looking for a slice of the countryside after having moved out of the city to look after her elderly father during lockdown

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Warwickshire to help Gill and John, a couple who cant agree what to do with their inherited two-bedroom home. With two growing children, John cant see this house ever working and hopes that a move closer to town will appeal to the kids as they become teenagers but Gills fond memories of her mum and the countryside on their doorstep mean that she cant imagine living anywhere else. Faced with a challenging layout, a long list of requirements and soaring build costs, Kirstie needs to find a solution with her £150,000 love-it budget. Meanwhile, Phil has a tricky task convincing Gill to list it but is determined to find three spectacular houses with enough space for the whole family, in an area with plenty going on

programme.title: New Zealands Best Homes with Phil Spencer
programme.desc: An intimate tour of some of New Zealands most stunning and desirable homes - from luxurious mountain retreats on the South Island to architectural wonders in the countrys biggest city, Auckland and everything in between. Phil meets the architects who dreamed up the designs and the owners who make these houses their homes. Phil begins with touring a country barn and a home that hangs over a cliff. His journey begins at Closeburn Lodge in Queenstown, a set of four large barns with views of the lake and its surroundings. At the aptly named Cliffhanger, Phil visits a large home perched on a cliffs edge - a year-round holiday home packed full of surprises and a view like no other before heading off to the beach town of Piha to visit a modern home designed with the surrounding elements in mind

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany visits Oman, on the southeastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula, where she investigates an ancient cold case in which she traces the life of a Desert Lord through shifting sands, camel markets and Bedu traditions. On Masirah Island, Bettany uncovers a biodiverse haven and evidence of Omans earliest sailors, dating back 8,000 years, and back on the mainland she explores a lush wadi, where archaeologists uncover traces of its first inhabitants, revealing how water, trade, and tradition have long shaped Omans story

programme.title: New Zealand by Train
programme.desc: Part two of two. New Zealands Northern Explorer scenic rail journey, which starts in the countrys largest city, Auckland, and ends at the capital Wellington, 420 miles away. The route required construction of numerous structures including long bridges to enable the train to ascend to the volcanic plateau, famed for its distinctive landscapes featuring active volcanoes amid the desert and pasture lands

programme.title: Hitlers DNA: Blueprint of a Dictator
programme.desc: Part one of two. At the end of the Second World War, an American colonel entered Hitlers bunker and cut a blood-soaked swatch of material from the couch where the tyrant shot himself. A team of scientists led by geneticist Professor Turi King and historian Dr Alex J Kay have extracted DNA from the fabric to investigate whether, as was suggested at the time, Hitler had a Jewish relative and if he had ADHD and autism

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: A slave named Django is tracked down by eccentric German bounty hunter Dr King Schultz, who offers him his freedom in exchange for help bringing three criminals to justice. The unlikely allies continue their partnership after the job is done, and fight to rescue Djangos wife from a sadistic plantation owner. Quentin Tarantinos Oscar-winning Western, starring Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: 127 Hours

Danny Boyles fact-based drama, with James Franco and Kate Mara

programme.title: Greatest Christmas Toys of all Time
programme.desc: A look at the must-have toys that dominated Britains gift lists from the 1970s to now. From Furbies to Teletubbies, and Buzz Lightyears to Rubiks cubes, this is the story of mile-long queues outside toy shops, and the ecstasy on Christmas morning of knowing that Santa brought you exactly what you wanted. Through archive clips and interviews with the creators (as well as the mega fans who collected them), cameras reveal how toy makers harnessed Christmas magic year after year to make dreams come true

programme.title: The Two Ronnies: The Lost Sketches
programme.desc: Comedy clip show looking back at material and songs by the duo recorded for their 1986 series The Two Ronnies in Australia. For the first time, the sketches will be screened in their entirety, and members of the Barker and Corbett families recall how much the pair enjoyed their Australian venture

programme.title: Birkhall: The Kings Private Residence
programme.desc: A look at the royal estate in Aberdeenshire, where King Charles proposed to Queen Camilla and which has been at the centre of some of the most explosive moments of royal history. From life-altering encounters to renovations that need to be seen to be believed, to the collapse of Charles and Dianas marriage, secrets have been locked behind these walls for nearly 200 years

programme.title: Charles: The Comeback King
programme.desc: A profile of Charles III, looking at how he has endured ridicule, rebuilt his reputation and ultimately emerged as a monarch shaped by resilience. The film explores both triumph and tragedy, including his marriage to Diana, Princess of Wales, the turmoil that followed, and his long journey toward public acceptance with Queen Camilla. Featuring contributions from Kate Williams, Wesley Kerr, Sarah Gristwood, Richard Fitzwilliams, Victoria Murphy, Clive Aslet, Kathy Lette and John Stonborough

programme.title: The Greatest TV of the...
programme.desc: The best programmes of the decade, featuring archive clips from shows including The Tube, The Young Ones, Brookside, EastEnders, Dallas, Dynasty and Blind Date. Michael Buerk speaks about his 1984 news report on the Ethiopian famine, while Coronation Street star William Roache remembers the storyline that saw Ken Barlow in a love triangle with wife Deirdre and arch enemy Mike Baldwin. Chris Tarrant talks about Tiswas and a spectacular prank involving Lenny Henry and Trevor McDonald, while The Bill star Trudie Goodwyn shares secrets from the show

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica and Chandler conduct an embarrassing interview with a potential sperm donor after learning they cannot conceive a baby naturally. programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends

South African born Nigel and his Welsh wife Nikki kick off the competition with dishes from Nigels homeland, while Darren and Simon attempt to woo their guests with a flavour of their first-class lifestyle on day two, before down-to-earth Neil and Carly offer up a taste of their favourite dishes on the final night

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Joker Lee plans a huge wedding for his pregnant bride-to-be Ellie, showing off his sense of humour and celebrating his dwarfism with a fairy tale Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs theme. However, his fiancee wants nothing more than a low key and intimate wedding, with no jokes and no mention of dwarfs

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Sports-loving Brazilian Eduardo takes sole charge of organising his wedding to Polish fiance Paulina, knowing full well that if he gets any small detail wrong, she will not hold back and smash everything in her way. With this in mind, he is under pressure is on to impress not only his bride-to-be but also all the guests

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.sub-title: The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf
programme.desc: John Fuller, the President and CEO of The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf, goes undercover in his own firm. Six years earlier, he did the same thing while he was CEO of 1950s diner chain Johnny Rockets. In disguise, he meets a barista, a shift supervisor and a general manager to check just how efficient his coffee shops really are

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partners parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jacks Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chefs advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Mangia Mangia, an Italian restaurant with an identity crisis in Woodland Park, Colorado, where guests have a choice between casual fine-dining service or a pick-up from the drive-through takeaway. Hard-nosed owner Julie finds herself completely at odds with the head chef, forcing her to breaking point

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Newlyweds Jen and Callum kick off the dinner party challenge in Aberdeen with an American-themed menu, while Debbie and her husband Shaun opt for Scottish-inspired dishes on the second night. Day three sees Sam and her boyfriend Jamie host, with each of the couples divulging their pet names for one another, before the winner of the £1,000 cash prize is revealed at the end of the night

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Bert collaborate on a research project, even though Sheldon is embarrassed to be associated with the study of geology. Penny and Bernadette coach Raj on how to navigate his fledgling relationship with Ruchi. Swati Kapila and Brian Posehn guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Howard are furious when they learn that Sheldon went to work with the military behind their backs. Angered, the pair ask Kripke to help them get their own back on Sheldon, much to his annoyance. Meanwhile, Bernadette suspects that Ruchi might be trying to steal her job while she is on bed rest, so she asks Raj to investigate for her, putting him in a very awkward position. Dean Norris guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys find a laptop that has some virtual currency on it. The only snag is, the computer belongs to Pennys ex-boyfriend Zack. Meanwhile, a seven-year-old video reveals a secret about Leonard and Pennys relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy try to eliminate stress from the planning of their wedding by applying mathematics to the process. Meanwhile, Raj breaks up with Howard after realising that his best friend is actually damaging his confidence

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a hybrid of the comedy panel show and the words-and-numbers quiz, as Sarah Millican and Josh Widdicombe take on Alan Carr and Thanyia Moore. Mathematician Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers, while comedy duo The Delightful Sausage join lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Greg Davies: The Back of My Mums Head
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy with the Man Down star, recorded at the Lowry in Salford. Stung by his mothers suggestion that he is not normal, Greg puts everyone else under the microscope in a petty quest to discover if anyone actually is. The tour received rave reviews and was extended to 94 dates, including multiple sell-out nights at Londons Hammersmith Apollo and Southbank Centre

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: When Mums best friend, Val moves in after rowing with her husband, Dad soon finds himself driven to distraction after the visitor repeatedly tidies up the house and chucks away all his old stuff. Tensions reach boiling-point when Val finds an aged tin of meat with a best before 1996 date that Dad has been storing in his shed. Tracy-Ann Oberman plays the unwelcome visitor in writer Robert Poppers award-winning comedy, alongside series regulars Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal, Tamsin Greig and Paul Ritter

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: It is Mums birthday and she is having a surprise party, with the chief surprise being that she has secretly organised it herself and does not want her friends to find out, so Dad has to pretend he arranged it. Adam and Jonny take her out for a pre-party drink, before she is set to return for the big surprise, but Dad realises hes made a terrible mistake and told all the guests the party is for the following week

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jacks Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chefs advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ted invites his old university professor, who told him he would never make it as an architect, to the grand opening of the GNB building. However, when the academic snubs him saying he does not know who he is, Ted goes back to the campus to confront him, taking the gang along for the ride. While there, Lily and Marshall run into an old acquaintance they would rather have avoided. Guest starring Seth Green and Peter Gallagher

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part two of two. Barney confides in Ted that he plans to propose to Patrice and swears him to secrecy, but Ted feels he should tell Robin what is happening, and asks her to be his date to the gala opening of the GNB building. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily enjoy their first night away together since the birth of Marvin and intend to savour every moment, but end up feeling anxious about their son

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin learns that Barney failed to ask her fathers permission before proposing, so she forces him to get Robin Srs approval as soon as possible. However, when she discovers that he has got married without telling her, she changes her mind. Meanwhile, Ted hides his disappointment at his friends engagement by helping plan their wedding

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted dates a 20-year-old woman with a busy social life, but soon discovers he has nothing in common with her. However, Barney begs Ted to continue the relationship so he can live vicariously through him. Meanwhile, Robin is upset when she realises wearing her engagement ring makes her seem invisible to a lot of young men

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall and Lily become concerned that Teds new girlfriend is a deranged stalker, but he insists they are destined to be together. programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: With Adams graduation approaching, Beverly debates staying on as William Penn Academys Quaker Warden. Meanwhile, Erica tries to get out of the Schwartzs longstanding tradition of dinner together every Sunday and the subsequent household chores

programme.desc: After a mould issue at home forces Erica and Geoff to stay at the Goldbergs, Beverly senses tensions in their marriage and seizes the opportunity to impart a little marital advice

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly is not coping well with the idea of an empty nest as Adams graduation day approaches, while Erica decides to try out as a back-up singer

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: In the wake of Murrays passing, Adam, Barry and Erica are all back at home to be closer to their mother, and the house is full of Goldberg chaos, which is driving pregnant Erica bonkers. She enlists Beverlys help to clear things out for the baby, while Adam and Barry have to share a bedroom to make room for the baby nursery

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is worried about how Beverly will handle him going off to college, so he tries to get a dream job right in their hometown

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Harry wants a wedding fit for royalty, but his partner Charlotte is not into airs and graces and is dreaming of something much more low key

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Impulsive groom Steve plans a cliff-hanger of a Wild West wedding, but demanding bride-to-be Leona dreams of a more sophisticated do

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Fun-loving groom-to-be Liam wants a wedding day that really celebrates his native Isle of Wight, but his future wife Kandi is hoping for a more conventional day

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Laid-back Liam plans to wow his bride with a wintry white wedding. But almost 2,000 miles away in Portugal, bride-to-be Georgia is dreaming of sun, sand and sangria. Will Liam get everyone in the Christmas spirit, or will Georgia lose that loving feeling?

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: A look at what happened after Gordon Ramsay headed to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he met husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who revealed a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faced the biggest challenge of the series to save Amys Baking Company - and a media furore unfolded after the episode was broadcast

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Denver, Colorado, where he meets the stubborn owner of Italian restaurant Pantaleones, who appears to be firmly stuck in the past. Pete maintains he makes the best pizza in town - based on a review from the 1980s - but the fiery chefs own taste test proves the opposite. With Petes wife Paulette and son Josh threatening to leave, can Gordon get through to him and save the business?

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the restaurants he tried to save, returning to Lido, Anna Vincenzos and Le Bistro to find out whether his advice has been put to good use

programme.desc: Sheldon and Amys attempts to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home are interrupted by the news that Bernadette has gone into labour. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Sheldon tests a newly invented device after hearing that it can help him to read peoples emotions. Raj gathers his ex-girlfriends together so that they can give him some dating advice

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, where he meets a stubborn owner who doesnt react well to criticism. Can the chef break Toms iron grip on the business and persuade him to change his outdated approach?

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarellas in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leones in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Beaver, Pennsylvania, where he meets a brother-and-sister team who find it almost impossible to work together. Their relationship is so fractured that theyre failing to save their fathers Italian restaurant Levantis from being overwhelmed by local competition, and the situation has become so desperate that their dad is in danger of losing his life savings

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sams Mediterranean Kabob Room in Monrovia, California, and within minutes of his arrival, is caught in the crossfire of an argument between the owner, his wife and their children, all of whom are feeling the pressure of working seven days a week. Can the chef save the business and mend the warring familys frayed relationships?

Comedy, guest starring June Squibb

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith judge a Christmas special featuring the Baker Ghosts of Christmas Past - one contestant from each previous series broadcast on Channel 4. They welcome Sophie from series 8, Dan from series 9, Amelia from series 10, Linda from series 11, George from series 12 and Carole from series 13 into the tent, before ending their festive celebration with a performance from the Citizens of the World Choir

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family wonders when Maggie will say her first word, which prompts Marge to reminisce about Lisas early days and how a two-year-old Bart suffered a serious outbreak of sibling jealousy. Featuring the guest voice of Elizabeth Taylor

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer has a heart attack but cannot afford proper medical care, so dodgy doctor Nick Riviera offers to perform a cut-price triple-bypass operation. Cartoon capers, with the voices of Dan Castellaneta and Hank Azaria

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge sets out to halt the plans of an unscrupulous businessman intending to defraud Springfields residents by supplying them with a defective monorail system. Featuring the guest voice of Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Selma decides to take her Aunt Gladyss advice and start a family - but a day in charge of Bart and Lisa at a beer-themed amusement park soon changes her mind

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart grows frustrated by Homers lack of interest in him and sets out to search for a new father figure. Lisa tries to break her addiction to an expensive teenage chat-line, but finds it harder than expected

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics cast their eyes over this years Christmas TV. Shows under their scrutiny include The Real Full Monty: Jingle Bells to Squid Game: The Challenge, An Audience with Kylie, The Repair Shop Christmas Special, Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One, Planet Earth, Men Up, The 1% Club Christmas Special, Fur Babies and Love Actually

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Jamies Air Fryer Meals, Baby Reindeer, Teen First Dates, The Circle, Wildlife Rescue and Expedition X. Plus, ITVs news coverage of Dogfather. First shown in April 2024

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics judge Britains Got Talent - will it be a yes or now for the return of the hit talent show? They also share their thoughts on Baby Reindeer, Red Eye, Love Triangle, In with a Shout and The Yorkshire Vet, as well as an item about bras on This Morning and a news item on seagulls. From April 2024

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Welsh beauty therapist Eve meets rugby-loving teaching assistant and compatriot Jordan. She has alopecia and has never been on a night out without her wig, but a head tattoo generates a great reaction. Meanwhile, model Jade wows her fellow daters as she walks into the restaurant, but can business owner Adam live up to this tall, blonde single mums exacting standards for the whole evening?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Violinist Maggie, who is 63 and has played in orchestras around the world, is searching for a man who shares her passion for the finer things in life and all things fabulous - can retired police officer and divorcee Alistair match up to her standards? Bricklayer Molly, 19, works with men all day, and her date is charming warehouse worker Hussein, who has to cope with her laddish banter

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the biggest and best shows. This episodes offerings include First Dates, This Morning, Hunted, Tiger King, EastEnders and The Queen. From May 2020

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Gemmas troublemaking sister returns, claiming she has turned over a new leaf, and Dave finally convinces Calvin to accompany him to an escape room

programme.desc: When Tina and Gemma get more than they bargained for in a revealing art class, Calvin cant hide his jealousy and takes drastic action

programme.title: Villages by the Sea

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to birds, revealing the role of their feathers, the ways in which they attract partners and the challenges they face during the nesting season. Narrator David Attenborough provides an insight into the courtship spectacle of the lesser flamingo on Kenyas Lake Bogoria, and follows chinstrap penguins in Antarctica, which make an exhausting climb up a volcano to feed their young

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to insects, whose key to success is an armoured covering that takes on almost any shape. Bombardier beetles fire boiling liquid at enemies through a rotating nozzle, while a honey bee army stings a raiding bear into submission. Grass-cutter ants march like a Roman army and cultivate a fungus to break down the grass they have harvested. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An insight into mammals ability to learn new tricks to aid hunting prey and evading predators. Slow-motion cameras reveal the star-nosed moles technique for detecting its next meal underwater, while an ibex runs up a steep cliff face to escape a fox. A killer whale off the coast of the Falklands sneaks into a pool used by elephant seal pups and snatches them, saving itself the trouble of searching for food in the open sea, and three cheetah brothers work together to hunt a zebra. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough turns his attention to marine invertebrates - bizarre and beautiful animals that thrive in the toughest parts of the ocean. Divers swim into a shoal of predatory Humboldt squid emerging from the depths to hunt in packs, and timelapse photography reveals starfish gathering under the Arctic ice to devour a seal carcass. A camera also follows a female octopus into a cave, where she hides to protect her eggs until she starves to death

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker supports a departmental construction project, but Sir Humphreys evasiveness and financial difficulties force the minister into a deal with a union leader. Starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker sees a chance to further his political career when a new hospital appears to have no patients. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: A conflict of interests arises at the Ministry of Administrative Affairs when Hacker introduces controversial cost-cutting measures. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker is disturbed to discover his department is responsible for supplying surveillance equipment to the government, which is then used to spy on its own ministers. However, a death threat soon changes his view on the situation. Political satire, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Plans to manufacture a controversial chemical at a factory on Merseyside cause disagreement between Jim Hacker and Sir Humphrey. Brenda Blethyn guest stars

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Cabinet reshuffle rumours and possible redundancy from high office anger Jim Hacker, who considers accepting an offer to become an EEC commissioner. Comedy, starring Paul Eddington

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Province of Quebec, taking the Charlevoix train along the north bank of the St Lawrence River to La Malbaie. Along the way he flies over the Laurentian Mountains in a seaplane, fishes for trout and views the waterfall at Montmorency from a zipwire - and thats just the first half of this leg

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by diving into and swimming in the neighbourhood pools along his route. Director Frank Perrys cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: A stiff-upper-lipped English salesman accidentally foils a raid on a stagecoach. Having acquired an undeserved reputation as a fearsome gunslinger, he is asked to become the sheriff of a wild frontier town - a job with a very short life expectancy. Comedy Western, starring Kenneth More, Jayne Mansfield, Ronald Squire and Robert Morley

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, starring Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth: 2150 AD
programme.desc: Eccentric time traveller the Doctor journeys into the future, where he finds his arch enemies the Daleks have taken over the Earth and are hatching an evil scheme to remove the planets core and turn it into a vast spaceship. Sci-fi adventure sequel based on the TV series, starring Peter Cushing, Bernard Cribbins, Andrew Keir, Roberta Tovey and Ray Brooks

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: The Creator
programme.desc: Grief-stricken ex-Special Forces operative Joshua hopes to end the war between humans and a rogue artificial intelligence by locating and destroying the architect of the enemy machines. Dystopian sci-fi action thriller, starring John David Washington, Gemma Chan and Ken Watanabe

programme.title: Boss Level
programme.desc: Former Special Forces operative Roy Pulver wakes every day in his apartment with a beautiful woman in his bed and assassins trying to kill him. Stuck in a time loop, Roy must dodge bullets and blade attacks to unlock the mystery behind his repetitive and untimely demise. Action comedy, starring Frank Grillo

programme.title: Klokkenluider
programme.desc: A government whistleblower and his wife are sent to a remote house in Belgium, and await the arrival of a British journalist. Writer/director Neil Maskells dark comedy, starring Jenna Coleman, Tom Burke and Amit Shah

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: A businessman running for mayor of New York saves the life of an orphan, and invites her to live with him as a publicity stunt. The tycoons cynical nature is chipped away at by the youngsters sunny disposition. Meanwhile, her cruel foster mother hatches a kidnapping plot. Musical remake, starring Quvenzhane Wallis, Jamie Foxx, Cameron Diaz and Rose Byrne

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: The close friendship of six women from different generations, living in a backwoods town in Americas Deep South, sustains them through lifes joys and disappointments. Drama based on the play by Robert Harling, starring Sally Field, Julia Roberts, Dolly Parton, Shirley MacLaine, Olympia Dukakis, Daryl Hannah and Sam Shepard

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerichs sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate
programme.desc: An augmented human and Sarah Connor must stop an advanced liquid Terminator named Rev-9 from hunting down a young girl in Mexico City, whose fate is critical to the human race. As the Rev-9 ruthlessly destroys everything and everyone in its path, the three are led to a T-800 from Sarahs past that may be their last best hope. Sci-fi adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Mackenzie Davis

programme.title: Infinity Pool
programme.desc: James and Em Foster are enjoying an all-inclusive beach vacation on the island of La Tolqa. However, a fatal accident exposes the resorts perverse subculture of hedonistic tourism, reckless violence and surreal horrors. Horror mystery, starring Alexander Skarsgard, Mia Goth, Cleopatra Coleman and Thomas Kretschmann

programme.title: Anna and the Apocalypse
programme.desc: When a sleepy town is hit by a zombie apocalypse, adventurous student Anna puts her plans for a gap year on hold as she and her friends get locked into a battle for survival. However, its not all bad, as they also find time to burst into the odd musical number. Comedy horror, starring Ella Hunt, Malcolm Cumming and Sarah Swire

programme.desc: Ageing outlaw Willie Nelson plunges straight back into a life of crime just hours after being released from prison - and uses the proceeds to reunite his equally long-in-the-tooth cohorts for an ambitious robbery. However, old enemy Richard Widmark is determined to stop the wrinkly renegades, leading them into a tense final showdown. Entertaining light-hearted Western, written and directed by cowboy movie veteran Burt Kennedy. Angie Dickinson, Stuart Whitman and Shaun Cassidy co-star

programme.title: Young Guns of Texas
programme.desc: A disgraced military cadet goes in search of the thieves who stole an army payroll. He is soon joined by three other men after the reward money, but they are pursued in turn by an angry rancher after one of them elopes with his daughter. As the three groups catch up with each other, they all face a common threat in a band of hostile Apaches. Western, starring James Mitchum and Alana Ladd

programme.desc: Josh is asked by a mother superior to find a missing nun who is believed to have been kidnapped by outlaws. Vintage drama, starring Steve McQueen

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her fathers killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderers trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: A veteran Union officer crosses paths again with a former Confederate enemy years after the end of the Civil War - and their past animosity resurfaces. However, when a Mexican general takes the ex-Confederate and his men hostage, the old Union soldier debates whether to surrender his herd of horses by way of ransom. Western, with John Wayne, Rock Hudson, Lee Meriwether, Tony Aguilar and Roman Gabriel
