programme.desc: Grace, a woman who lives and breathes Christmas 365 days a year, takes charge of running her New England hometowns famous Christmas parade. Festive romance, starring Jodie Sweetin and Eric Winter

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jasmines article about Nicola makes the front page, leaving Rodney shocked about her behaviour. Jack has a heart-to-heart with Victoria about Diane.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy accompanies Hayley to her aunts funeral, where they are greeted with hostility, Casey asks Ashley to give her another chance and Norris confides in Doreen.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Hayley makes a startling revelation and confides her fears to Becky, while Norris invites an intrigued Emily to dinner and Casey makes another attempt to win over Ashley.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: In the final episode of the ninth series, Martin rushes to Ruths for a medical emergency, and preparations for Morwenna and Als wedding do not go to plan. Elsewhere, Martin takes his final GMC assessment under the watchful eye of eminent surgeon Bernard Newton, who monitors Martins skills in assisted surgery. Starring Martin Clunes, Tom Conti, Caroline Catz and Jessica Ransom

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch makes a surprise announcement on his birthday that causes an argument between Weatherill and Ormerod, but the celebrations are interrupted when a bus full of day-trippers plunges down a nearby embankment. Susie bets Lizzie she will get Carnegie to ask her out, and Jack is given a fright when a body in the mortuary springs back to life. Rural drama starring Ian Carmichael, Robert Cavanagh and co-starring Gareth Hale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Tension mounts as explosives go missing from Lord Ashfordlys quarry just before the Defence Minister is due to arrive on an official visit to Fylingdales early warning station, prompting Blaketon to embark on an off-the-record investigation. Meanwhile, Dr Alway makes the mistake of enlisting Vernon and David as bellringers - will the duo drop a clanger?

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A serious road accident causes chaos for the residents of Aidensfield when a tanker containing a mysterious substance is breached, leaving a reservoir polluted and Ashfordly police tearing their hair out as they try to track down the culprit. Luckily, the staff of nearby St Aidans Royal Free hospital are on hand to offer some much-needed assistance

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Nicola seduces David and Jasmine wonders if he was faithful when they were together. Chas and Lexi sell their bionic bears and Katie and Gray grow closer.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rosemarys car is found abandoned near Manor Farm and Matthew is taken in for questioning. Katie lets Jonny in on her secret, while Chas and Lexi are quizzed about the bears.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ashley grows increasingly anxious as Casey continues to stalk him, Norris takes a bemused Rita for lunch and pops the question, while Roy worries about Hayleys state of mind.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: A deranged Casey kidnaps Freddie and locks him on her balcony in his pram, warning Ashley she wont release his son until he talks to her. Eileen and Jerry make a date.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Following the altercation, relations between Robert and Cora are strained, while Blakes scheming starts to come to fruition when Mary is unexpectedly pitted against her love rival. Edith decides to take drastic measures after receiving terrible news, leaving various parties reeling. Baxter is embroiled in the investigation into Greens death following a mysterious tip-off, and as Thomass health deteriorates, he finally reveals the truth to the maid. Elsewhere, love is in the air for more than one member of the Crawley family. Guest starring Sue Johnston (The Royle Family, Coronation Street)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After having his career scrutinised by the General Medical Council because of his blood phobia, Martin makes efforts to overcome his fear and begins to question whether he made the right decision about resigning. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jennys younger brother Steve pays a visit, and soon begins to threaten her relationship with Merton. Meanwhile, David sets his sights on joining a mod gang causing havoc in the village. Sarah Tansey, Thom Fell, Maureen OBrien and Robert East star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress thinks Mikes replacement PC Steve Crane is too anxious to prove his worth as he investigates a spate of farm break-ins on the moors, and Vernon causes chaos trying to impress new arrival Dr Liz Merrick with his community spirit. Elsewhere, Mike grows disillusioned with CID work. James Carlton and Aislin McGuckin star as the newcomers

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of killings in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding, it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day sinners. With help from sidekick Charlie Nelson, Barnaby tries to get to the bottom of the case, and unearths a long-held secret that takes him by surprise. With Rebecca Front, Andrea Lowe, Vincent Regan and Roy Hudd

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Keen to unwind, Geordie and Will head to a charity boxing match at Vics gym. However, as Matthew and Luke face off in the ring the bout takes an unexpected twist. Will wonders if hes misjudged Matthew all along and when two boys are later found near death, Will must face up to his own part in the tragedy to help uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Leonard tries to reunite the warring Chapmans, who seem determined never to see eye-to-eye again. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a woman is found dead laid out in the shape of a crucifix on Jesus Green, Will and Geordie are led to a nearby convent where they meet steely Sister Grace, who rules over her flock with an iron fist. Even more sinister is the picture that starts to emerge as they match the nuns to a series of unsolved missing persons cases from the previous five years. Meanwhile, when Leonards father, Russell, arrives in Grantchester, its clear theres no love lost between parent and son. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Sean Gilder star

programme.title: Cracker
programme.desc: Part two of two. Impulsive murderers Grady and Nash hide in an abandoned factory, unaware Fitz is hot on their trail. Temple blackmails Penhaligon with Becks tell-all diary, and Judith slides deeper into depression as the responsibilities of motherhood start to dawn on her. Drama, starring Robbie Coltrane, Barbara Flynn and Geraldine Somerville

programme.title: Cracker
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fitz is surprised to receive love letters from a secret admirer who thinks he is perfect, but is soon brought back down to earth by the discovery of a naked murder victim. However, the arrival of another letter makes him realise the killer and his secret admirer are the same person. Starring Robbie Coltrane, Kieran OBrien and Emily Joyce

programme.title: On the Buses

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Gruff detective Jack Frosts plans for a quiet weekend are disrupted by the gruesome discovery of an unidentified body floating in the river. However, soon after he has begun the investigation, he is forced to apply his deductive skills to a separate case involving an act of violence during a football match which left a player in a coma. Crime drama, starring David Jason, Larry Lamb, Bruce Alexander, Lindy Whiteford and Berwick Kaler

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate the murder of a businesswoman connected with an organisation that supports gifted children, who had apparently been blackmailing the father of one particularly promising youngster. Further deaths follow, and as the body count rises, they realise there is a decades-old secret at the heart of the case. Matters are complicated still further by the presence in Oxford of former MI5 spymaster Grace Orde, who is visiting to sign copies of her tell-all memoir - which provides a vital clue to the killers identity. Detective drama, guest starring Anna Chancellor and Cherie Lunghi, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: A royal visit to a family owned munitions factory puts a spring in the step of Chief Superintendent Bright, but Morse is still stuck on general duties and excluded from the event. However, when an unpopular worker is found murdered in a secluded area of the shop floor, the detective finds himself drawn into the affairs of the company and its dysfunctional owners. The prime suspect is a colleague who had fallen out with the victim over an industrial accident, and Bright is eager for the investigation to be carried out as quickly and quietly as possible, but Endeavour is not convinced the case can be solved so easily. Shaun Evans stars, with Martin Jarvis, Jenny Seagrove and Craig Parkinson

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomers own Stella Harris. When the actresss more famous sister Diana returns after a 40-year family rift, the body count rises, with each crime reminiscent of a movie plot - giving Barnaby and Jones what looks like a disturbing case of life imitating art. Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes star, with Harriet Walter and Sinead Cusack

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When dairy worker Debbie Moffett (played by Martine McCutcheon) is crushed to death by a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue, Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case. Pathologist Kate Wilding discovers the victims daughter was being expelled from the local prep school and it emerges Debbie died just hours after an argument at a parents council meeting. Her phone leads the detectives to Oliver Ordish, with whom she was having an affair

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of killings in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. programme.desc: Coma victim Harriet Farmer finally wakes up a year after she was attacked while trying to elope, but her boyfriend Finn Robson is still missing. Soon after she regains consciousness, members of a chess club are targeted by a killer. Could the assault that left Harriet for dead be linked to moves on a games board? Guest starring Fay Ripley (Cold Feet), with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddies professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddies death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison

programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Alongside rare home-movie footage of the band at work, there are also interviews with Jagger, Keith Richards, Bill Wyman and Charlie Watts

programme.title: The Rolling Stones: Welcome to Shepherds Bush
programme.desc: A 1999 concert by the band at Shepherds Bush Empire, featuring performances of Honky Tonk Women, Route 66, Tumbling Dice, Brown Sugar and Jumpin Jack Flash

programme.title: Muddy Waters and the Rolling Stones - Live at the Checkerboard Lounge
programme.desc: As part of the Stones mammoth 1981 American tour, the rock band arrived in Chicago prior to playing three nights at the Rosemont Horizon. Long influenced by Chicago blues, they paid a visit to Buddy Guys club, The Checkerboard Lounge, to see Muddy Waters perform. Shortly afterwards, they joined the blues musician on stage for this performance

programme.title: The Yardbirds
programme.desc: A history of the rock band, which was the launching pad for guitarists Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck and Jimmy Page. With contributions by Ronnie Wood, Brian May and Alice Cooper

programme.title: Greatest Albums Live
programme.desc: Accompanied by the Southbank Sinfonia at the London Palladium, pop band ABC perform and discuss The Lexicon of Love, one of the 1980s most successful debut albums

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: In this edition the actor explores the luxury hotels of Hong Kong. Home to more skyscrapers than any other city, he first checks in to the Mandarin in the financial district, before experiencing the Four Seasons, the only hotel with two Michelin three-star resturants, as well as the timeless Peninsula in Kowloon, which even provides a Rolls-Royce airport taxi service. He ends his stay at the Ritz-Carlton, home to the worlds highest swimming pool

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of Londons most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: A dark comic drama following the lives of three American mothers, as their seemingly perfect suburban lives begin to unravel with deadly repercussions

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Madeline is outraged over a slight from Renata while dealing with family issues at home. Jane deflects Ziggys questions about moving to Monterey, while Nathan and Ed try to calm troubled waters. Reese Witherspoon and Shailene Woodley star

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.sub-title: Wanted Dead or Alive _ Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Falsone and Stivers take a case involving bounty hunters who killed the wrong man while in pursuit of a fugitive. Police drama, starring Toni Lewis and Jon Seda

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.sub-title: Wanted Dead or Alive _ Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ghartys impending meeting with the divorce lawyers leaves him feeling fraught, Lewis is rushed to hospital after McGees accident and Gee refuses to cooperate with the bounty hunters. Peter Gerety and Yaphet Kotto star

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Robb and his bannermen gather at the Twins in the northern Riverlands to attend the wedding of Lord Edmure Tully and Roslin Frey, daughter of Lord Walder. Elsewhere, Jon faces his harshest test to date, Daario and Ser Jorah debate how to take Yunkai, and Bran discovers a new gift. Fantasy drama based on George RR Martins A Song of Ice and Fire novels, starring Richard Madden, Michelle Fairley and David Bradley

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The various warring factions of Westeros receive news of the events of the wedding at the Twins. In Kings Landing, Joffrey stands up to his grandfather Tywin, Daenerys discovers whether shell be remembered as a conqueror or a liberator in Yunkai, and mercy comes from a surprising source in Dragonstone. Fantasy drama, starring Emilia Clarke, Charles Dance and Jack Gleeson

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Madeline gets under Renatas skin in retaliation for snubbing Ziggy, while Celeste and Perry see a counsellor, and Jane opens up about her past

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Nathan invites Madeline to a dinner to discuss Abigail, and Celeste angers Perry by lending her legal skills to get the play back on track

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kellerman defends a girl accused of murder after a newborn babys body is found buried behind a hotel _ and advises his client that she should try to implicate her boyfriend. Reed Diamond stars

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Part two of two. Debbie signs the plea agreement implicating Craig in the murder of the baby, but Falsone wants more time to work on the case

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Tyrion is sent out to welcome a royal party from Dorne outside the walls of Kings Landing, and Jon Snow finds himself on trial at Castle Black over his time with the wildlings and the death of Qhorin Halfhand. Daenerys heads toward the slave city of Meereen, and Arya runs into a familiar face. Fantasy drama, starring Peter Dinklage, Emilia Clarke and Kit Harington

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, the day of King Joffreys wedding to Margaery Tyrell arrives, and while the sadistic monarch delights in tormenting his uncle Tyrion, the capitals various factions plot further alliances. However, all attention is drawn back to Joffrey following the arrival of a pie filled with live birds. Meanwhile, Melisandre oversees a sacrifice to the Lord of Light at Dragonstone as three traitors are burned at the stake, and the future continues to look grim for Theon as Ramsay Snow finds a use for him. North of the Wall, Bran sees clearly where he and his friends must go after experiencing a series of visions

programme.title: All Her Fault
programme.desc: As Detective Alcaras investigates Milos disappearance, Marissa and Jenny work to raise awareness and a press conference turns ugly. Mystery thriller starring Sarah Snook

programme.title: The Undoing
programme.desc: Grace finds herself on the receiving end of detectives Mendoza and ORourkes questions. Later, Graces father insists she and Henry seek refuge at his house

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Artie reaches crisis point as his business starts to go under in the face of fierce competition from a new restaurant. Meanwhile, Christopher and Little Carmine head west to pursue their new idea for a film, but become obsessed with stealing celebrity goodie bags, and Tony decides to take a break from the hunt for Vito. Guest starring Ben Kingsley and Lauren Bacall

programme.title: LImmortale
programme.desc: As Ciros body slowly sinks in the Gulf of Naples, memories of his life of crime emerge. Prequel to Crime drama series Gomorrah, starring Marco DAmore. In Italian

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ser Dontos spirits Sansa out of Kings Landing and rows her out to a waiting ship, and Pod gives Tyrion news of his forthcoming trial. Tywin counsels Tommen on what makes a good king and also has an offer for Oberyn Martell. Sam decides Castle Black is not a safe places for Gilly, while Jon proposes a bold plan after the wildlings send a chilling message. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys picks a champion to take on the best that Meereen has to offer and Davos has an idea about raising funds for Stanniss cause

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, Jaime finally visits Tyrion in jail after some persuasion from Bronn, and he also has a mission for Brienne. Daenerys tries to balance justice and mercy in Meereen. At Castle Black, Jon asks for volunteers when Ser Alliser decides to let him go to Crasters Keep to deal with the mutineers. Fantasy drama, starring Emilia Clarke, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau and Kit Harrington

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Teenager Logan starts work as an apprentice deck-hand, while landlady Pat recalls fond memories from her life in Brixham

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Fish merchant Robert and his wife Kelly decide to open a seafood restaurant in Brixham - but their determinedly contemporary approach to cuisine leaves some locals unimpressed. The programme also follows the journey of a turbot over 36 hours, as it is caught and auctioned off before being served in an exclusive London restaurant

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor heads to Tokyo and checks out the Park Hyatt, the hotel featured in the film Lost in Translation, and goes behind the closed doors of the Japanese capitals love hotels. In the fashionable district of Meguro, Richard takes in the Claska, which was the citys first boutique hotel and has its own canine beauty salon

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the citys biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britains grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Night King and the army of the dead reach Winterfell, and an epic battle between the living and the dead begins. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: After the Battle of Winterfell, the Great War to gain control over the mythical land of Westeros continues as Jon and Daenerys look to the south. Meanwhile, Jon shares a secret with his siblings. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Varys betrays his queen, and Daenerys brings her forces to Kings Landing as the explosive final battle for the Iron Throne begins. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The final episode of the fantasy drama based on George RR Martins A Song of Ice and Fire series of novels. The Great War to gain control over the mythical land of Westeros continues. In the aftermath of the devastating battle at Kings Landing, Daenerys declares her intentions for Westeros, and Tyrion faces the consequences of his actions. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Lord Eddard Stark is torn between his family and an old friend when he is asked to serve at the side of King Robert Baratheon. However, neither man is aware that their country is on the verge of a bitter power struggle that could lead to its destruction. First episode of the fantasy drama based on George RR Martins A Song of Ice and Fire series of novels, starring Sean Bean, Mark Addy, Lena Headey and Emilia Clarke

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Bran clings to life as Ned prepares to head south with the king - only for the youngster to come under attack once more. Jon discovers a different side to Tyrion when he accompanies him on a journey to the Wall, while Daenerys becomes more assertive toward her new husband, the warlord Khal Drogo. Fantasy drama, starring Sean Bean, Mark Addy and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ned finally takes up his role at the side of the king, but struggles to deal with the political power games of Roberts cunning advisers. The weary lord is asked to organise a tournament, but finds the royal finances in a dire state - and his job is made even harder by troubling news from home. Meanwhile, Tyrions visit to the Wall reveals the men of the Nights Watch are in desperate need of reinforcement, and relations between Daenerys and Viserys become increasingly strained. Fantasy drama, starring Sean Bean and Mark Addy

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ned searches for the truth about Jon Arryns death, but is far from certain he can trust Pycelle or Littlefinger. The balance of power between the exiled Targaryens shifts dramatically, Jon Snow befriends a vulnerable new recruit at the great Wall, and Brans recovery is made more difficult by a series of disturbing dreams. Fantasy drama, starring Sean Bean, Aiden Gillen and Julian Glover

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ned tries to stop Robert from entering the tournament after a suspicious death threatens to overshadow the event - and the competition is plunged into chaos when one of the favourites suffers a surprise defeat. Meanwhile, Catelyn takes the captive Tyrion east in search of refuge at the Eyrie, home of her sister Lysa. Fantasy drama, starring Sean Bean and Mark Addy

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ned is reinstated by Robert and hears rumours that associates of the Lannisters have begun stirring up trouble across the Seven Kingdoms. Tyrion concocts a risky scheme to escape the Eyrie, Brans first trip outside the castle since his accident nearly ends in tragedy, and Viserys causes uproar in Khal Drogos home city. Drama, starring Sean Bean

programme.title: The Iris Affair
programme.desc: Iris makes a potentially suicidal return to Caliburn. A showdown exposes the terrifying true purpose of the device

programme.title: It: Welcome to Derry
programme.desc: When a major find yields few clues, General Shaw pushes ahead with his top-secret mission, ordering Leroy and Pauly to escort Dick Hallorann on an aerial search for a new dig site. Meanwhile, Rose attends a tribal meeting about the military presence in Derry, and Ronnie, Lilly, Will and Rich attempt to get visual proof by conjuring an Orixá

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Nathan invites Madeline to a dinner to discuss Abigail, and Celeste angers Perry by lending her legal skills to get the play back on track

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tonys bizarre dream continues, while Paulie and Cary DiBartolo find a vast amount of cash during a raid. Silvio admits to his wife he does not feel ready to be boss and that it is not a position he really wanted to be in. Benny and Murmur take JT to see Christopher, who gives the screenwriter an ultimatum. Gritty crime drama, starring James Gandolfini and Tim Daly

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.sub-title: The Fleshy Part of the Thigh
programme.desc: Jason Barones father dies, leaving him to make a mammoth decision about the future of the family business that ends in a violent confrontation. Paulie learns his aunts real identity, while a rapidly improving Tony befriends a rapper who has been admitted to the hospital with a gunshot wound

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.sub-title: Mr and Mrs John Sacrimoni Request
programme.desc: Johnny Sack is granted temporary leave from prison so he can attend his daughters wedding, where he puts pressure on Tony to kill Rusty Millio. The gangster agrees, though it is apparent he is still weak from the shooting, so he later tries to prove his strength by picking a fight at the Pork Store. Junior continues to protest his innocence, and lawyers argue over his mental stability

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Gossip is rife about Vitos secret life after he is seen in a gay bar, prompting him to go on the run. Tony and Christopher plan for Rustys death and enlist the help of Italian-speaking heroin addict Corky Caporale, while Meadow comes to the aid of a Muslim family whose son has seemingly been unlawfully arrested. Gritty crime drama, starring James Gandolfini

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixhams annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: A wealthy playboy inherits a media empire when his father dies. Determined to do some good for a change, he uses his new-found fortune to become a masked crime-fighter. Aided by his chauffeur, who is a kung fu expert and a technical genius, he fights to bring down a powerful gangster. Comic-book adventure, starring Seth Rogen, Jay Chou, Cameron Diaz and Christoph Waltz

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after an absence of several years to find his lost love Lois Lane has moved on with her life. Meanwhile, arch-villain Lex Luthor is out of jail and about to wreak havoc on the world with technology stolen from Supermans home planet of Krypton. Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey

programme.title: Red Right Hand
programme.desc: Cash is attempting to live an honest and quiet life, but when Big Cat forces him back into her services, he proves capable of anything to protect the town and the only family he has left. Thriller, starring Orlando Bloom and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, Baby, a young getaway driver with tinnitus, takes part in a heist which seems doomed to fail, especially as the characters involved lose touch with reality as events spiral out of control. Writer/director Edgar Wrights Bafta-winning, music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Lily James, Jamie Foxx, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm

programme.title: Novocaine
programme.desc: When the woman of his dreams is kidnapped, a man turns an inability to feel physical pain into an unexpected advantage in his quest to rescue her. Action comedy, starring Jack Quaid, Ray Nicholson and Amber Midthunder

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: While exploring space for new worlds, a probe belonging to the Life Foundation discovers a comet covered in symbiotic lifeforms. Following the probes return to Earth, journalist Eddie Brock investigates sinister trials being carried out by the corporation, and after being infected by an alien symbiote, develops superhuman strength and power. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy and Riz Ahmed

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: A former Marine sniper is coaxed back into action when government officials need his help to prevent an assassination attempt on the US president. However, the intended target is in fact an African archbishop, and the marksman is set up by double-crossing agents to take the fall, forcing him to go on the run as he fights to clear his name. Action thriller, with Mark Wahlberg, Michael Pena and Danny Glover

programme.title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance
programme.desc: The demon biker roams Eastern Europe, looking for a way to rid himself of his supernatural alter ego. He is approached by a mysterious monk, who needs help protecting a boy from the horrific destiny the Devil has in store for him. Fantasy thriller sequel, starring Nicolas Cage, Idris Elba, Ciaran Hinds and Christopher Lambert

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: Two mismatched undercover cops set out to halt an underground gang war and bring down a drug lord attempting to flood the market with a deadly form of Ecstasy. However, a romantic interlude threatens to drive the investigation off course. Comedy thriller sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Gabrielle Union, Jordi Molla and Peter Stormare

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: The underwater kingdom of Atlantiss fate hangs in the balance when ruthless mercenary David Kane, aka Black Manta, attempts to avenge his fathers death at the hands of Aquaman by wielding a mythical trident. Fantasy adventure, starring Jason Momoa, Yahya Abdul-Mateen II, Patrick Wilson, Dolph Lundgren, Nicole Kidman and Amber Heard

programme.title: Kraven the Hunter
programme.desc: Conservationist Sergei Kravinoffs complex relationship with his ruthless father, Nikolai, sets him on a path of vengeance with brutal consequences, motivating him to become Kraven, the worlds most feared hunter. Fantasy adventure, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Russell Crowe and Ariana Debose

programme.title: One More Shot
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL squad leader escorts a suspected terrorist from a black site when they come under fire from a group of mercenaries. Director James Nunns thriller, starring Scott Adkins, Alexis Knapp and Tom Berenger

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlins thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: A wealthy playboy inherits a media empire when his father dies. Determined to do some good for a change, he uses his new-found fortune to become a masked crime-fighter. Aided by his chauffeur, who is a kung fu expert and a technical genius, he fights to bring down a powerful gangster. Comic-book adventure, starring Seth Rogen, Jay Chou, Cameron Diaz and Christoph Waltz

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: A military officer goes in search of a power-mad general who is holding several hostages in a secret location. He soon finds he is not the only one on the maniacs trail, and joins forced with a mismatched band of martial artists to save the captives. Action adventure based on the video game, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Raul Julia, Kylie Minogue and Ming-Na Wen

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: Two mismatched undercover cops set out to halt an underground gang war and bring down a drug lord attempting to flood the market with a deadly form of Ecstasy. However, a romantic interlude threatens to drive the investigation off course. Comedy thriller sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Gabrielle Union, Jordi Molla and Peter Stormare

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Journalist Eddie Brock and symbiote partner-in-crime Venom are lying low in Mexico City, on the run for the apparent murder of detective Patrick Mulligan. The cop and his bonded entity, Toxin, are actually alive at the Imperium symbiote containment programme, beneath the Area 51 US Air Force facility in the Nevada desert. Knull, the symbiotes immortal creator, dispatches hunters to locate Venoms hidden power source, the Codex, which can set Knull free to terrorise the multiverse. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Stephen Graham and Juno Temple

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bays sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Normandy landings, a group of American soldiers scours the battlefields of France in search of a missing infantryman, who has been given compassionate leave to return home because his brothers have been killed in the conflict. Steven Spielbergs Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Matt Damon, Barry Pepper and Vin Diesel. It won five Academy Awards, including Best Cinematography, Best Film Editing, and Best Director. The film makers also took home a couple of Baftas for Best Sound and Best Special Effects

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after an absence of several years to find his lost love Lois Lane has moved on with her life. Meanwhile, arch-villain Lex Luthor is out of jail and about to wreak havoc on the world with technology stolen from Supermans home planet of Krypton. Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: A warlord in ancient China sends out messengers throughout his kingdom to declare a reward for whoever can kill three assassins intent on murdering him. In response, a warrior arrives at the rulers palace and claims that he has already defeated the would-be killers, but his story does not quite ring true. Martial arts adventure, starring Jet Li, Tony Leung Chiu Wai and Maggie Cheung Man-Yuk. In Mandarin

programme.title: The Inseparables
programme.desc: A puppet and an abandoned stuffed animal toy cross paths in Central Park and pair up for an epic adventure in New York City. Animated adventure, with the voices of Monica Young and Danny Fehsenfeld

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 4
programme.desc: Po returns to find and train a new dragon warrior,while a sorceress plans to summon all of his past enemies for revenge. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jack Black, Awkwafina, Viola Davis, Dustin Hoffman, Bryan Cranston and Ian McShane

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: Santa Claus gift-giving routine has developed into a complex hi-tech operation. However, when one girl is accidentally missed out, his youngest son Arthur takes control of the family sleigh to deliver her gifts the old-fashioned way - but following in his fathers footsteps is not as easy as it looks. Animated comedy, with the voices of James McAvoy, Jim Broadbent and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Diabolical nemesis Maxime Le Mal and his femme fatale girlfriend Valentina target Anti-Villain League agent Gru, girlfriend Lucy, their girls Margo, Edith and Agnes and new addition Gru Jr. The family goes on the run while the Minions invade AVL HQ. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Will Ferrell

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling koalas attempt to save his theatre with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates, while the finalists of the contest find that their lives will never be the same again. Animated comedy, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane, Scarlett Johansson, John C Reilly, Taron Egerton, Jennifer Saunders and Jennifer Hudson

programme.title: The Angry Birds Movie
programme.desc: When a peaceful island is visited by mysterious green piggies, its up to Red, Bomb and Chuck, outcast flightless birds, to get to the bottom of the suspicious invaders. Animation, with the voices of Jason Sudeikis, Josh Gad, Danny McBride, Maya Rudolph and Bill Hader

programme.title: The Angry Birds Movie 2
programme.desc: Red joins forces with Leonards team as the flightless birds and scheming green pigs take their war to the next level. When a new threat emerges that puts both Bird and Pig Island in danger, Red, Chuck, Bomb and Mighty Eagle recruit Chucks sister Silver and team up with pigs Leonard, his assistant Courtney and techpig Garry to forge an unsteady truce and form an unlikely superteam to save their homes. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Peter Dinklage, Tiffany Haddish and Dove Cameron

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 3
programme.desc: The clumsy hero is reunited with his long-lost father, whose help he will need when a supernatural foe threatens all of China. Father and son travel to a secret village populated by other pandas, and must train them in martial arts so they can defend their home. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black, Bryan Cranston, Angelina Jolie and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: Santa Claus gift-giving routine has developed into a complex hi-tech operation. However, when one girl is accidentally missed out, his youngest son Arthur takes control of the family sleigh to deliver her gifts the old-fashioned way - but following in his fathers footsteps is not as easy as it looks. Animated comedy, with the voices of James McAvoy, Jim Broadbent and Bill Nighy

He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Migration
programme.desc: Anxiety-crippled mallard Mack spins nightmarish bedtime stories to educate his children, Dax and Gwen, about the perils of straying from the comfort of Moose Head Pond. Eventually Mack organises a spontaneous family migration south from leafy New England to Jamaica, accompanied by curmudgeonly uncle Dan. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Kumail Nanjiani, Elizabeth Banks, Danny DeVito and Carol Kane

programme.title: Teen Titans Go! To The Movies
programme.desc: Five teenage superheroes, miffed by the fact they arent deemed worthy enough for their own big screen films, set out to prove themselves by tackling the villainous Slade and his maniacal plan for world domination. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Greg Cipes, Scott Menville, Khary Payton, Will Arnett and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: The Angry Birds Movie 2
programme.desc: Red joins forces with Leonards team as the flightless birds and scheming green pigs take their war to the next level. When a new threat emerges that puts both Bird and Pig Island in danger, Red, Chuck, Bomb and Mighty Eagle recruit Chucks sister Silver and team up with pigs Leonard, his assistant Courtney and techpig Garry to forge an unsteady truce and form an unlikely superteam to save their homes. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Peter Dinklage, Tiffany Haddish and Dove Cameron

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling koalas attempt to save his theatre with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates, while the finalists of the contest find that their lives will never be the same again. Animated comedy, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane, Scarlett Johansson, John C Reilly, Taron Egerton, Jennifer Saunders and Jennifer Hudson

programme.title: The Angry Birds Movie
programme.desc: When a peaceful island is visited by mysterious green piggies, its up to Red, Bomb and Chuck, outcast flightless birds, to get to the bottom of the suspicious invaders. Animation, with the voices of Jason Sudeikis, Josh Gad, Danny McBride, Maya Rudolph and Bill Hader

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: A pampered pet rodent is flushed down a toilet and ends up in a vast underground rat city in the sewers of London. He is befriended by a quick-witted rat who offers to help him find his way home, but first the hapless pair have to escape the clutches of an evil toad bent on ridding the rodent metropolis of its residents. Animated comedy, with the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Ian McKellen, Shane Richie, Jean Reno and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Shrek
programme.desc: Anti-social ogre Shrek resolves to stop an evil ruler from banishing fairy-tale characters to his swampland home. However, the reluctant hero ends up forced to rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona from a castle guarded by a dragon, aided only by a wisecracking donkey. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, John Lithgow, Cameron Diaz, Eddie Murphy and Vincent Cassel

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: A raccoon trickster is fretting about his debt to a fearsome bear when he stumbles on some animals waking in the woods after their winter nap. Spotting the chance to solve his problem, the raccoon dupes the gullible creatures into stealing food from a nearby suburb so he can give it to the bear - but they fail to realise they will soon be at the mercy of a vermin exterminator. Animated comedy, with the voices of Bruce Willis, Steve Carell, Garry Shandling and William Shatner

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: An alien on the run from his own people arrives on Earth and embarks on an adventure with a daring young woman. It turns out to be a life-changing trip during which they begin to understand the true meaning of the word home. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Jim Parsons, Rihanna, Steve Martin and Jennifer Lopez

programme.title: Rise of the Guardians
programme.desc: Magical beings from folklore, including Santa Claus, Jack Frost and the Easter Bunny, join forces to defeat the plans of an evil spirit, who intends to steal the dreams of children and use the power they grant him to dominate the world. Animated adventure, with the voices of Chris Pine, Alec Baldwin, Hugh Jackman, Isla Fisher and Jude Law

programme.title: The Pirates! In an Adventure with Scientists!
programme.desc: The bungling leader of a band of inept buccaneers is determined to prove his worth to his rivals and win the coveted Pirate of the Year award. An encounter with the naturalist Charles Darwin gives him the chance to pull off a daring crime - if he can survive coming face to face with the pirate-hating Queen Victoria. Animated comedy, with the voices of Hugh Grant, Martin Freeman, Imelda Staunton and David Tennant

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: A hero is needed to defend a peaceful valley community from attack by a rampaging snow leopard. The unlikely candidate for the job is a lazy panda, who enlists the aid of a legendary team of animal fighters and their wise master to teach him the martial arts skills he needs to fulfil his destiny. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane and Jackie Chan

programme.title: Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas
programme.desc: A swashbuckling hero has 10 days to recover a priceless book from a deceitful sea goddess or his friend will be executed. As he sets out on his quest, he discovers the condemned mans fiancee has stowed away on board his ship to make sure he goes through with the task. Animated adventure, with the voices of Brad Pitt, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Joseph Fiennes and Michelle Pfeiffer

programme.title: Rise of the Guardians
programme.desc: Magical beings from folklore, including Santa Claus, Jack Frost and the Easter Bunny, join forces to defeat the plans of an evil spirit, who intends to steal the dreams of children and use the power they grant him to dominate the world. Animated adventure, with the voices of Chris Pine, Alec Baldwin, Hugh Jackman, Isla Fisher and Jude Law

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Barton Academy boarding school teacher Paul Hunham incurs the wrath of headmaster Dr Hardy Woodrup by failing the son of a powerful senator. As punishment, Woodrup selects Paul to remain on campus over Christmas to chaperone the boys who wont be travelling home for the holidays. Alexander Paynes comedy drama, starring Paul Giamatti, DaVine Joy Randolph and Dominic Sessa

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: Santa Claus gift-giving routine has developed into a complex hi-tech operation. However, when one girl is accidentally missed out, his youngest son Arthur takes control of the family sleigh to deliver her gifts the old-fashioned way - but following in his fathers footsteps is not as easy as it looks. Animated comedy, with the voices of James McAvoy, Jim Broadbent and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: As a young boy, Willy Wonka inherits a love of chocolate from his mother. When she dies, Willy pursues his dream of opening a chocolate shop in the arcade where confectionery titans Slugworth, Fickelgruber and Prodnose have boutiques. The three entrepreneurs secretly bribe the Chief of Police to thwart Willys ambitions. Co-writer/director Paul Kings fantasy adventure, starring Timothee Chalamet, Calah Lane, Olivia Colman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: The Grinch
programme.desc: In the magical town of Whoville, a race of human-like creatures called Whos are thrilled about celebrating Christmas. However, a cantankerous, furry green loner named the Grinch, who lives in a cave north of Whoville, hatches a dastardly scheme to ruin the festive season. Animated Dr Seuss adaptation, with the voices of Benedict Cumberbatch, Pharrell Williams and Rashida Jones

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: Santa Claus gift-giving routine has developed into a complex hi-tech operation. However, when one girl is accidentally missed out, his youngest son Arthur takes control of the family sleigh to deliver her gifts the old-fashioned way - but following in his fathers footsteps is not as easy as it looks. Animated comedy, with the voices of James McAvoy, Jim Broadbent and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: As a young boy, Willy Wonka inherits a love of chocolate from his mother. When she dies, Willy pursues his dream of opening a chocolate shop in the arcade where confectionery titans Slugworth, Fickelgruber and Prodnose have boutiques. The three entrepreneurs secretly bribe the Chief of Police to thwart Willys ambitions. Co-writer/director Paul Kings fantasy adventure, starring Timothee Chalamet, Calah Lane, Olivia Colman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: A heartless TV executive is cruel to his employees and sees the festive season as nothing more than an opportunity to make money. However, on Christmas Eve, three ghosts arrive in the night and challenge him to change his cynical ways by showing him his past, present and future. Comedy based on Charles Dickens A Christmas Carol, starring Bill Murray, Karen Allen, John Forsythe, David Johansen and Carol Kane

programme.title: National Lampoons Christmas Vacation
programme.desc: An American householder is dismayed when his plans for a traditional festive family holiday are thrown into complete disarray by a succession of annoying neighbours and long-lost relatives, who turn up on his doorstep offering their own brand of Christmas cheer. Comedy, starring Chevy Chase, Beverly DAngelo, Randy Quaid, Diane Ladd, Juliette Lewis, Miriam Flynn, Johnny Galecki and William Hickey

programme.title: Gremlins
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: A boy is left disillusioned with Christmas as his dysfunctional family spend the holiday arguing. They must soon learn to work together if they are to see New Year, when a monstrous demon appears, intent on punishing them for their lack of festive spirit - and which has the power to make the houses Christmas decorations take on murderous life. Comedy horror, starring Toni Collette and Emjay Anthony

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: While heading home, Hawthorne College student Lindsey is impaled with an icicle by a masked individual. Its the beginning of a bloodthirsty rampage, prompting Riley Stone and her friends to fight back. Co-writer/director Sophia Takals horror remake, starring Imogen Poots, Lily Donoghue, Aleyse Shannon and Brittany OGrady

programme.title: A Boy Called Christmas
programme.desc: An ordinary boy, with a loyal pet mouse and a reindeer at his side, sets out on an extraordinary adventure to find his father, who is on a quest to discover the fabled village of Elfhelm. Festive family adventure, starring Henry Lawfull, Toby Jones, Sally Hawkins and Kristen Wiig

programme.title: The Grinch
programme.desc: In the magical town of Whoville, a race of human-like creatures called Whos are thrilled about celebrating Christmas. However, a cantankerous, furry green loner named the Grinch, who lives in a cave north of Whoville, hatches a dastardly scheme to ruin the festive season. Animated Dr Seuss adaptation, with the voices of Benedict Cumberbatch, Pharrell Williams and Rashida Jones

Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner

programme.title: The Polar Express
programme.desc: A boy begins to doubt whether Father Christmas really exists as he waits for the sound of sleigh bells on Christmas Eve. But he and hundreds of other lucky children receive a shock when a magical steam engine arrives in the night to take them to the North Pole and meet the man himself. Robert Zemeckis animated adventure, based on Chris Van Allsburgs book, features the voices of Tom Hanks, Leslie Zemeckis and Eddie Deezen

programme.title: The Grinch
programme.desc: In the magical town of Whoville, a race of human-like creatures called Whos are thrilled about celebrating Christmas. Comedy, starring Chevy Chase, Beverly DAngelo, Randy Quaid, Diane Ladd, Juliette Lewis, Miriam Flynn, Johnny Galecki and William Hickey

The three entrepreneurs secretly bribe the Chief of Police to thwart Willys ambitions. Co-writer/director Paul Kings fantasy adventure, starring Timothee Chalamet, Calah Lane, Olivia Colman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner

programme.title: A Keller Christmas Vacation
programme.desc: Three reluctant adult siblings join their parents on a Christmas river cruise through Europe, each dealing with personal issues. Drama, starring Brandon Routh (Superman Returns), Jonathan Bennett and Eden Sher

programme.title: Youve Got Mail
programme.desc: Two rivals in the bookshop business fall in love over the internet, unaware they know and dislike each other in the real world. While things remain frosty in person, the pairs anonymous online relationship continues to blossom. Romantic comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, Greg Kinnear, Parker Posey and Dabney Coleman.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Nov 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 3
programme.desc: The blue hedgehog, Knuckles and Tails reunite to face the might of the villainous Shadow, who possesses powers unlike anything they have seen before. Outmuscled on every front, Sonic seeks help from an unlikely source, Dr Ivo Robotnik. Fantasy adventure sequel based on the videogame, starring Jim Carrey, James Marsden and Tika Sumpter

programme.title: Hook
programme.desc: Peter Pan, who has finally grown up and is now a married lawyer with a family of his own, is whisked away by Tinkerbell to Neverland, where he must learn to fly again if he is to save his children from the clutches of Captain Hook. Steven Spielbergs fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A hi-tech computer chip has a bizarre effect on a squad of toy soldiers, causing mayhem for their owner as the miniature marauders engage in a series of scaled-down skirmishes. Childrens adventure mixing live action and computer animation, starring Kirsten Dunst, Denis Leary and Gregory Smith, with the voices of Tommy Lee Jones, Frank Langella, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Christina Ricci

programme.title: Lemony Snickets A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the childrens books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: Mr Beans Holiday
programme.desc: The bumbling fool wins first prize in the church raffle - a trip to France and a video camera. His travels cause chaos as he disrupts a film shoot in Cannes, to the fury of its megalomaniac director, and is then accused of kidnapping a youngster. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Willem Dafoe, Emma de Caunes and Max Baldry

programme.title: Wicked
programme.desc: Green-skinned Elphaba Thropp becomes part of the new intake at Shiz University, and shares a room with fellow spell-caster Galinda Upland. Its the beginning of a friendship which culminates in an epic showdown as Elphaba transforms a renegade witch with a skill for bursting into show-stopping songs, like Defying Gravity. Part one of The Wizard of Oz prequel based on the hit stage musical, starring Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande-Butera, Jonathan Bailey, Michelle Yeoh and Jeff Goldblum

programme.title: IF
programme.desc: A young girl called named Bea goes through a difficult time with her father and suddenly gains the ability to see imaginary friends (IFs). Bea learns her upstairs neighbour Cal also possesses the same power and they join forces to matchmake IFs with new children. Fantasy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Cailey Fleming, with John Krasinski, who also wrote and directed

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptunes crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway
programme.desc: Thomas and Bea are now married and living with Peter and his rabbit family. Bored of life in the garden, Peter goes to the big city, where he meets shady characters and ends up creating chaos for the whole family. Adventure sequel, starring Rose Byrne and Domhnall Gleeson, with the voices of James Corden and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Fact-based period drama based on the life of Peter Pan author JM Barrie. As a young-at-heart playwright, Barrie is uncomfortable with life in the critical spotlight. However, his friendship with four boys and their free-spirited widowed mother brings him the inspiration for his greatest work. Starring Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Dustin Hoffman, Julie Christie, Freddie Highmore and Kelly Macdonald

programme.title: Ella Enchanted
programme.desc: In a fantasy world where a fairy godmother endows each newborn with a special attribute, baby Ella is given the unwelcome gift of obedience. While growing up, she is magically compelled to do anything she is told to, and her stepmother takes great delight in forcing the girl to obey her every whim. So Ella sets out on a quest to find her fairy godmother and get her to take back her unwanted birthright. Fantasy adventure, starring Anne Hathaway, Hugh Dancy, Cary Elwes, Minnie Driver and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptunes crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: Mr Beans Holiday
programme.desc: The bumbling fool wins first prize in the church raffle - a trip to France and a video camera. His travels cause chaos as he disrupts a film shoot in Cannes, to the fury of its megalomaniac director, and is then accused of kidnapping a youngster. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Willem Dafoe, Emma de Caunes and Max Baldry

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Blue-collar caveman Fred Flintstone is promoted to an executive position at work and unwittingly becomes embroiled in an embezzlement scheme - thanks in no small part to his seductive new assistant. Live-action version of the cartoon comedy, starring John Goodman, Rick Moranis, Rosie ODonnell, Halle Berry and Elizabeth Taylor

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: British wizard Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York City with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released after an inadvertent switching of suitcases with a baker. With a strange, dark force terrorising the Big Apple, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel written for the screen by JK Rowling, starring Eddie Redmayne, with Katherine Waterston, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Jon Voight, Dan Fogler and Carmen Ejogo

programme.title: Wicked
programme.desc: Green-skinned Elphaba Thropp becomes part of the new intake at Shiz University, and shares a room with fellow spell-caster Galinda Upland. Its the beginning of a friendship which culminates in an epic showdown as Elphaba transforms a renegade witch with a skill for bursting into show-stopping songs, like Defying Gravity. Part one of The Wizard of Oz prequel based on the hit stage musical, starring Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande-Butera, Jonathan Bailey, Michelle Yeoh and Jeff Goldblum

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenager at a new school befriends a pretty girl, but her ex-boyfriend is jealous and attacks him. During one particularly bad fight, a wise old caretaker intervenes and defeats the youngsters assailants using his martial arts skills. He goes on to mentor the boy and teach him karate so he can face his enemies in a tournament. Drama, with Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita and Elisabeth Shue

programme.title: IF
programme.desc: A young girl called named Bea goes through a difficult time with her father and suddenly gains the ability to see imaginary friends (IFs). Bea learns her upstairs neighbour Cal also possesses the same power and they join forces to matchmake IFs with new children. Fantasy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Cailey Fleming, with John Krasinski, who also wrote and directed

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: A family tragedy woos Delia Deetz, daughter Lydia and rebellious teenage granddaughter Astrid back to the close-knit community of Winter River. Astrid accidentally opens a portal to the afterlife by summoning Beetlejuice three times. The mischievous demon ricochets between realms, wreaking havoc wherever he goes. Tim Burtons comedy sequel, starring Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder and Jenna Ortega

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: British wizard Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York City with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released after an inadvertent switching of suitcases with a baker. With a strange, dark force terrorising the Big Apple, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel written for the screen by JK Rowling, starring Eddie Redmayne, with Katherine Waterston, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Jon Voight, Dan Fogler and Carmen Ejogo

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski

programme.title: Ella Enchanted
programme.desc: In a fantasy world where a fairy godmother endows each newborn with a special attribute, baby Ella is given the unwelcome gift of obedience. While growing up, she is magically compelled to do anything she is told to, and her stepmother takes great delight in forcing the girl to obey her every whim. So Ella sets out on a quest to find her fairy godmother and get her to take back her unwanted birthright. Fantasy adventure, starring Anne Hathaway, Hugh Dancy, Cary Elwes, Minnie Driver and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: Two Second World War evacuees face a dilemma when they meet a German pilot who has been shot down. Family drama, starring John Bardon and Stacey Tendeter

programme.title: Through a Glass Darkly
programme.desc: A former mental institution inmate returns to her family, but faces an uphill struggle to readjust to life in the outside world. Ingmar Bergmans drama, starring Harriet Andersson and Max von Sydow. In Swedish

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: A woman on the run after stealing from her boss ends up at an isolated motel, where the owners curious relationship with his domineering mother results in murder. Alfred Hitchcocks psychological thriller, starring Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles, Martin Balsam, John Gavin and John McIntire

programme.title: Shirley Valentine
programme.desc: A Liverpudlian housewife is trapped in a humdrum existence and a dull marriage. Fed up, she decides to go on an unheard-of holiday by herself to a Greek island, where she starts to enjoy life again - especially when she is romanced and seduced by a smooth-talking fisherman. Comedy, adapted from Willy Russells stage play, starring Pauline Collins, Tom Conti, Bernard Hill, Julia McKenzie and Alison Steadman

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: A teenagers parents forget her birthday, so she tries to get over her disappointment by searching for the man of her dreams, unaware shes looking in the wrong place. Comedy drama, starring Molly Ringwald, Justin Henry and Anthony Michael Hall

programme.title: Multiplicity
programme.desc: A workaholic whose demanding job often keeps him away from home hits on the idea of cloning himself so he can spend more time with his wife and kids. However, this is when his problems really begin, as the clones start to take over his house. Comedy, starring Michael Keaton, Andie MacDowell, Harris Yulin and Richard Masur

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitlers plans for world domination - aided by Joness deceitful French rival. The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies

programme.title: Last Action Hero
programme.desc: A boy watching an action movie is transported into the film by a magic ticket and meets its hero figure, who refuses to believe he is a fictional character. Matters take a turn for the worse when the screen villain gets hold of the ticket and crosses over into the real world - where bad guys can win. Comedy adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Austin OBrien, Charles Dance, F Murray Abraham and Anthony Quinn

programme.title: Blade Runner
programme.desc: A former cop in a bleak future Los Angeles is forced to return to duty for a mission to hunt down and kill a group of renegade android replicants. The fugitives have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth, in a bid to prolong their limited lifespan. Theatrical cut of Ridley Scotts sci-fi thriller, originally released in cinemas, starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young and Daryl Hannah

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: A woman on the run after stealing from her boss ends up at an isolated motel, where the owners curious relationship with his domineering mother results in murder. Alfred Hitchcocks psychological thriller, starring Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles, Martin Balsam, John Gavin and John McIntire

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Normandy landings, a group of American soldiers scours the battlefields of France in search of a missing infantryman, who has been given compassionate leave to return home because his brothers have been killed in the conflict. Steven Spielbergs Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Matt Damon, Barry Pepper and Vin Diesel. It won five Academy Awards, including Best Cinematography, Best Film Editing, and Best Director. The film makers also took home a couple of Baftas for Best Sound and Best Special Effects

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: Dimwitted Rhode Island limousine driver Lloyd Christmas and his equally vacuous friend Harry Dunne embark on a disaster-fraught cross-country trip to Aspen, where they hope to reunite a briefcase with its female owner. However, the pair are unaware the case contains a $1million ransom they would have been better leaving well alone. Farrelly brothers comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Jeff Daniels, Lauren Holly, Teri Garr and Mike Starr

programme.title: Waynes World
programme.desc: Two heavy-metal fans broadcast an amateur TV programme from their basement. A slimy network executive offers them the chance to turn professional, but as they enjoy the perks of wealth and fame, they find their show being ruined by corporate interference. Comedy, starring Mike Myers, Dana Carvey, Rob Lowe, Tia Carrere and Lara Flynn Boyle, with a cameo by Alice Cooper

programme.title: Waynes World 2
programme.desc: Heavy metal fanatics Wayne and Garth try to stage a giant Woodstock-style rock festival, with a little help from a spaced-out British roadie and the ghost of Jim Morrison. But Wayne also has to stop his girlfriend leaving him for her slimy manager. Comedy sequel, starring Mike Myers, Dana Carvey, Ralph Brown, Kim Basinger, Tia Carrere and Christopher Walken

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Oppressed Mexican villagers cross the border into America looking to buy guns to defend their homes and crops from bandits. Instead they encounter an enigmatic loner who persuades them to hire a band of gunslingers to teach the villagers how to fight before the marauders return. Western, with Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn, James Coburn and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Big Daddy
programme.desc: An immature 32-year-old is heartbroken when his girlfriend walks out on him. In a plan to win her back, he volunteers to look after his flatmates five-year-old son, thus demonstrating he is finally ready to grow up. However, his ideas of childcare prove unconventional and chaos quickly ensues. Comedy, with Adam Sandler, Joey Lauren Adams, Jon Stewart, Josh Mostel, Leslie Mann, Rob Schneider and Kristy Swanson, alongside Steve Buscemi in a cameo role

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit
programme.desc: A truck driver accepts a challenge to deliver a consignment of beer to a party. He claims he can make the 900-mile round trip in just 28 hours, but a pompous sheriff is determined to stop him in his tracks, not least because his prospective daughter-in-law has deserted his son and hitched a ride with the unlikely hero. Comedy, starring Burt Reynolds, Jackie Gleason, Sally Field and Jerry Reed

programme.title: Blade Runner
programme.desc: A former cop in a bleak future Los Angeles is forced to return to duty for a mission to hunt down and kill a group of renegade android replicants. The fugitives have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth, in a bid to prolong their limited lifespan. Theatrical cut of Ridley Scotts sci-fi thriller, originally released in cinemas, starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young and Daryl Hannah

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: A fledgling superhero crash-lands on Earth after evacuation from his home planet and is taken in by an elderly couple who raise him as their own. But with adolescence comes a greater understanding of his superhuman powers, leading to his rebirth as a crusader for justice and defender of the American way of life. Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel meets his match in the form of three fugitive villains from his home planet of Krypton. Flying down to Earth, the super-powered trio unleash a reign of terror in a bid to take over the world - but Superman is not there to stop them, having surrendered his powers to lead a normal life with his beloved Lois Lane. Comic-strip adventure sequel, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Terence Stamp and Margot Kidder

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: A deep-space salvage crew investigate mysterious events aboard a hi-tech spaceship, which suddenly reappeared in orbit around Neptune after going missing for seven years - but it is not long before they are exposed to terror beyond their wildest nightmares. Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Oppressed Mexican villagers cross the border into America looking to buy guns to defend their homes and crops from bandits. Instead they encounter an enigmatic loner who persuades them to hire a band of gunslingers to teach the villagers how to fight before the marauders return. Western, with Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn, James Coburn and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and Youve Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: My Dead Friend Zoe
programme.desc: An Afghanistan veteran comes head to head with her Vietnam vet grandfather at the familys lake house. Comedy drama, starring Sonequa Martin-Green (The Walking Dead), Natalie Morales and Ed Harris

programme.title: A Newport Christmas
programme.desc: A charitable and spirited Newport socialite in 1905 dreams of using her cash to start a foundation to help others in town. Romantic drama, starring Wes Brown and Ginna Claire Mason

programme.title: Lake George
programme.desc: Two misfits embark on a road trip, take a dubious deal and find redemption amid shady circumstances. Crime thriller, starring Carrie Coon and Shea Wingham

programme.title: Mickey 17
programme.desc: In 2054, criminal Mickey Barnes signs up to be a worker who agrees to be reprinted every time he perishes. He flees Earth with friend and accomplice Timo on an interstellar mission to the remote colony of Niflheim, masterminded by Kenneth Marshall and his wife, Ylfa. The 17th iteration of Mickey is presumed dead after a close encounter with creatures on the planets surface, but is saved from a grim fate, and when he arrives back at base, Mickey meets his reprinted self. Director Bong Joon Hos sci-fi comedy, starring Robert Pattinson, Naomi Ackie, Mark Ruffalo, Toni Collette and Steven Yeun

programme.title: A Newport Christmas
programme.desc: A charitable and spirited Newport socialite in 1905 dreams of using her cash to start a foundation to help others in town. Romantic drama, starring Wes Brown and Ginna Claire Mason

programme.title: Black Bag
programme.desc: When a spy is suspected of treason, her husband faces the ultimate test - loyalty to his marriage or his country. Director Steven Soderberghs thriller, starring Michael Fassbender, Cate Blanchett and Rege-Jean Page

programme.title: The Woman in the Yard
programme.desc: Inside a rural farmhouse, painter Ramona Harris recuperates with a leg brace following a head-on car collision that claimed the life of her husband. Out of the blue, a woman in funereal garb materialises in a chair on the front lawn of the fixer-upper, and she has no intention of leaving. Psychological horror, starring Danielle Deadwyler, Peyton Jackson and Estella Kahiha

programme.title: Mickey 17
